title: AI-Native WordPress SEO Systems Engineer (Programmatic websites + SEO + content)
description:
Overview



We are building an AI-powered operating system that includes a website deployment engine for HVAC, plumbing, roofing, solar, and electrical companies.



This is not a typical WordPress role.

We are not building one-off websites.

We are building a scalable SEO + automation system.



You must think in systems, not pages.



What You’ll Do



Architect reusable WordPress templates for local service businesses



Design programmatic service + city page structures



Implement correct schema (LocalBusiness, Service, FAQ)



Configure RankMath or custom schema injection



Optimize Core Web Vitals at the template level



Work with AI-generated content pipelines



Design blog automation workflows



Build GBP auto-posting pipelines



Structure internal linking at scale





Required



3-5+ years WordPress development



Deep understanding of local SEO structure



Experience with schema markup



Deep understanding of SEO and AEO/GEO 



Familiarity with REST APIs



Experience integrating automation tools (Make / n8n / APIs)



Must use AI tools daily (Claude, GPT, Cursor, Claude Code)



Must think in scalable templates



Expert in the WordPress plug-ins required for scale and automation



Familiarity with LLMs



Ability to make replicable templates for local businesses and directories



Bonus



Experience in HVAC / home services and/or local businesses



Experience with programmatic SEO



Experience scraping + normalizing content



Experience working with large-scale site duplication



Questions

1) Explain how you would build a scalable HVAC template capable of generating 100+ service + city pages with proper schema and internal linking, using AI to populate content.



2) Describe how you think we should take an existing website and GBP and programmatically extract all relevant information, and then populate the website template with existing information + generative new content 



3) What is your weekly availability in hours, and what is your expected compensation?

title: Corporate Sales Manager – Real Estate Solutions
description:
Job Position is BASED IN SINGAPORE




.sg



Full job description : 



Start Something Purposeful. 



At Urban Space Group , we believe in creating concepts that allow people, business and purpose to come together and thrive. We’re a privately owned real estate group dedicated to real estate concepts for industrial and commercial spaces. We are both owners of industrial properties, commercial shophouses and spaces, as well as operators of business models and concepts such as urbanspace self storage, Urbanpod workspace etc. 



We actively invest to expand our asset portfolio and grow our industrial and shophouse asset management capabilities and offerings.  



We’re looking for a Business Development and Sales Manager to bring our asset investment and management services to our clients, partners and stakeholders. 



Why Join Acuvest :



Your Mission :



To be part of the team to grow our asset portfolio and drive performance through innovations and teamwork. 



This is a full-stack business development and sales role with plenty of room to use your skillsets in sales, strategy, innovation and execution. You’ll lead a motivated team and collaborate closely with other departments. You will report to the Business Development / Sales Director and play a critical role in the company’s performance. 



Why Join us :



- Mentored by management of a company with decades of experience in investment management, property management, development, and self-storage solutions across Singapore and the region. We combine strategic insight with innovation, offering real opportunities to grow and make an impact across a diversified real estate portfolio.



- Build an Elite Network: Connect directly with a high-value network of Corporate and SME business leaders / decision-makers, building a powerful network for your long-term career success. 



- Thrive in a High-Growth Self-Storage Sector. Our self-storage business, Co-working business space, E-commerce fulfilment hubs, serve both individual and corporate clients with flexible space solutions in a fast-rising market. You’ll be at the forefront of lead generation, networking, and deal closing—driving measurable results in an expanding industry.



- Collaborative Culture. Real Career Progression. Work with experienced professionals across property and investment teams, gain exposure to full deal cycles, build strong client relationships, and accelerate your career in sales and business development at Acuvest.



Full job description : What you will be doing



Property Leasing : 



- Develop and implement leasing strategies and initiatives to maximize occupancy, rental income, and tenant satisfaction 



- Identify leasing opportunities and prospective tenants that align with the positioning and target market of each property, and develop relationships with tenants and prospective tenants. 



- Negotiate lease agreements, including terms and conditions, rental rates, lease incentives, and lease renewals, and ensure compliance with company policies and industry standards. 



- Collaborate with property management teams to conduct market research and analysis, assess competitive landscape, and identify trends and opportunities in the property market. 



- Develop and maintain leasing budgets, forecasts, and reports, and track leasing activity, occupancy rates, and financial performance against targets and benchmarks. 



- Manage tenant relations and communication, including addressing tenant inquiries, resolving disputes, and ensuring tenant compliance with lease terms and property rules and regulations. 



- Represent the company at industry events, trade shows, and networking opportunities to promote our properties and attract potential tenants and partners. 



Self storage sales : 



- Work closely self storage sales team and management on drive the sales and occupancy of our self storage business. 



Property Investment : 



- Work closely with Management team to develop business opportunities for new property investment and development projects on a project basis. 



- Unlock Potential: Identify underutilized properties and devise creative strategies to maximize their value and utility



Requirements : Who we are looking for.



- Strong business acumen and a strategic mindset. Enterprenuerial mindset 



- An outgoing, optimistic personality with exceptional interpersonal skills. Strong networking and interpersonal skills. 



- The ability to communicate confidently and effectively at all levels. Excellent communication skills, with the ability to build relationships and influence stakeholders at all levels. 



- Minimum of 5 years of experience working experience. 



- Strong understanding of leasing principles, market dynamics, and negotiation strategies in the real estate industry. 



- Proven track record of successfully negotiating lease agreements, driving occupancy, and achieving leasing targets and goals. 



- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to analyze market data, evaluate leasing opportunities, and make data-driven decisions. 



- Results-oriented mindset with a focus on driving leasing outcomes and delivering exceptional customer service to tenants and partners. 



- Ability to manage multiple projects and priorities simultaneously in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment. 



- An eagerness to learn and grow through hard work and dedication

title: Founding US Expat Tax Preparers (CPA / EA Preferred): Independent Contractor | Remote | Pre-Launch Team
description:
We are building a modern, technology-enabled firm focused exclusively on American taxpayers living abroad.



We are launching later this year and are forming our founding team of experienced US Expat Tax Preparers now.



This is not a seasonal volume tax job.

We are building structured systems, clear workflows, and long-term professional relationships from day one.



About the Firm



We serve one niche only:



US citizens and green card holders living overseas.



Our focus is precision, organization, and clean digital workflows,  not high-volume domestic 1040 preparation.



We are building:



Structured digital intake systems



Clear documentation standards



Organized workflow processes



A technology-enabled environment that reduces chaos



We are recruiting early so we are fully prepared when client volume begins.



We are building an AI-Native cloud accounting firm that is technology first. 



Required Experience



You must have direct experience preparing US expat tax returns, including:



Form 1116 (Foreign Tax Credit)



Form 2555 (Foreign Earned Income Exclusion)



FinCEN 114 (FBAR)



Form 8938



Form 5471 (strongly preferred)



Form 3520



Form 8621 (PFIC experience preferred)



Additional requirements:



CPA or EA preferred (strong expat experience considered)



3–5+ years relevant US tax experience



Strong written and spoken English



Ability to work independently in a remote environment



Highly organized and deadline-driven



Comfortable working with digital systems and cloud-based workflows



Compensation



This is an independent contractor role.



Compensation:



Hourly: $10–$20/hour depending on experience and complexity level



Initial workload: Part-time during pre-launch phase



Opportunity to scale hours as client volume increases



We will begin with structured hourly engagement while workflows are finalized. As volume stabilizes, compensation structure may evolve based on performance and specialization.



There are no fixed quotas.

You take on work you can responsibly handle.



Founding tea
mbers will receive priority allocation once client flow begins.



Sister Company Stability



We also operate a separate bookkeeping firm serving small businesses.



For those interested, this may provide:



Off-season income opportunities



Ongoing advisory support



More consistent year-round engagement



Participation is optional.



What We Value



We are looking for professionals who:



Take ownership of their work



Communicate clearly and proactively



Respect deadlines



Care about accuracy



See technology as a tool to improve efficiency



This is a long-term professional relationship, not short-term seasonal hiring.



Timeline



We are currently:



Interviewing and vetting candidates



Finalizing systems and workflows



Preparing for launch later this year



Selected candidates will be onboarded prior to launch.



To Apply



Please submit:



Resume



Summary of your expat tax experience



Approximate number of expat returns prepared annually



Your availability during peak filing season



Your expected hourly rate

title: SHORT FORM VIDEO EDITOR | Flexible Work Schedule
description:
We’re hiring someone who knows how to turn long-form content into sharp, high-retention short videos for platforms like TikTok, Instagram Reels, and YouTube Shorts.



This role is for someone who understands pacing, hooks, and visual rhythm in short-form content, and knows how to edit with intention rather than just cutting clips.



—-----------------------------------------------------------------------------



READ THE ENTIRE JOB LISTING CAREFULLY. The final step of the hiring process will require the candidate to provide at least 1 former employer/team lead reference and at least 1 character reference. These will be verified prior to extending an offer.



--- ABOUT THE TEAM ---

Want to work in a rewarding, fast-paced, start-up atmosphere? Looking for significant growth and performance bonus opportunities? Have a growth mindset, value relationships, and dedicated to getting results? Then we might be a fit!



What is it like to work with us? HEAR FROM OUR TEAM!   





Our Core Values:

1) DELIGHT THE CLIENT:  We consistently exceed expectations by anticipating needs, delivering outstanding service, and creating those “magic 
nts” where every client feels seen and heard.

2) MASTER YOUR CRAFT:  We commit to continuous learning, share our expertise openly, and tackle every challenge with precision and a deep sense of duty.

3) FOLLOW THROUGH, ALWAYS:  When we say something will happen, it does—every time. We own every task, ensuring that nothing falls through the cracks, and when mistakes occur, we learn and improve immediately.



Our core values are important and the right candidate will share our values. We are building an awesome place to work, not just cutting together videos for our real estate business.



--- ABOUT YOU ---

Do you have strong creative instincts and know how to spot 
nts that make people stop scrolling? Are you proactive, adaptable, and detail-oriented? Do you have a sharp sense of pacing, an instinct for hooks, and a clear understanding of how short-form videos need to flow to hold attention? Do you take pride in clean edits and delivering videos that feel intentional and finished? Do our core values sound like a fit for who you are?



Then keep reading to see if we're a fit!



Responsibilities:

Short-Form Editing & Story Selection

- Review long-form videos, transcripts, or raw footage to identify short-form clip opportunities

- Select 
nts that are clear, engaging, and platform-appropriate

- Edit vertical videos optimized for TikTok, Instagram Reels, and YouTube Shorts

- Create strong hooks, clean cuts, and natural pacing

- Deliver publish-ready videos that meet brand and platform standards



Captions, Visuals & Formatting

- Add on-screen captions (burned-in or SRT as required) with proper timing and readability

- Apply basic motion, zooms, punch-ins, and visual emphasis where appropriate

- Follow platform-specific formatting (aspect ratio, duration, safe margins)



Iteration & Workflow

- Implement feedback efficiently and meet agreed turnaround times

- Maintain clear file naming and folder organization

- Track edits, revisions, and delivery status as required



Requirements:

- A STABLE, HIGH-SPEED INTERNET CONNECTION, REQUIRED (at least 150mbps)

- Experience with Final Cut Pro X (or other editing software, such as Adobe After Effects and Premiere Pro) is required

- Strong preference for MacOS users

- Experience editing short-form vertical content for social platforms, required

- Strong understanding of short-form pacing, hooks, and retention

- Experience working from transcripts or long-form content, required

- Clean file organization and understanding of post-production workflo

- Portfolio of completed short-form video projects, required

- General understanding of brand, content marketing, YouTube, etc, required

- GREAT interpersonal and communication skills, required

- Ability to self-start, work on a tight schedule, and manage multiple project deadlines, required

- Ability to follow directions and a LOVE of completing lots of projects according to consistent specifications, required

- Growth mindset, required



--- APPLICATION & RECRUITMENT PROCESS ---

STEP 1:

Fill out the application form through the link below and write "green kangaroo" in the Additional Comments field.


 



STEP 2:

Qualified candidates may be invited to participate in two PAID test projects, $10-20 USD for each test project estimated to be 2-3hrs of work for each (a total of $40 USD!).



STEP 3:

Candidates who advance through the test project rounds will be invited to an interview.



STEP 4:

Before extending a trial offer, we will conduct a CHARACTER REFERENCE CHECK for the final candidate(s). CONDUCTING A REFERENCE CHECK will be the last step in the hiring process.



STEP 5:

Upon receiving a trial offer, you will be onboarded as a Video Editor with a 90-day PAID trial period. During this period, we expect you to demonstrate your video editing expertise, meet project deadlines, be a team player, and excel at what you do. A successful trial will lead to a permanent offer to join the team.

title: AI-Powered Video Editor (Direct Response & E-com Ads)
description:
About the Role

We are a fast-scaling DTC brand group in the Kids and Education space. We believe that creative volume is the #1 driver of revenue, and we are looking for a "beast" of an editor who can keep our "Ad Factory" running.



This is a high-volume, output-based role. We aren't looking for someone to work "hours"—we are looking for someone to deliver results. You must be an AI-forward editor who uses modern tools (ElevenLabs, Midjourney, AI Video, etc.) to produce high-energy, high-converting ads at a pace that traditional editors can't match.



The Mission: High-Volume Output

Daily Goal: Deliver approximately 5 minutes of finished, high-quality footage every day (this includes VSLs, UGC mashups, and multiple hook variations).



Speed: First drafts must be delivered within 24–48 hours.



Independence: You source your own B-roll, generate your own AI voiceovers, and handle assets without being spoon-fed.



Direct Response: You edit for conversions, not just "vibes." You understand how to stop a parent's scroll in 3 seconds.



Requirements

AI Tool Mastery: You must be an expert in using AI to speed up your workflow (Image gen, AI voice, automated captions, etc.).



E-com Portfolio: Mandatory experience with Direct Response ads.



Communication: You must be available for daily updates via 
.



Reliability: You are looking for long-term, stable work and can handle a consistent daily workload.



Compensation & Incentives

Flat Rate: $1,000 USD per month (Paid weekly at $250/week).



Performance Bonuses: We reward winners. You will receive cash bonuses for every "Winning Ad" you create that hits our scaling targets.



Trial Process: Top candidates will do a paid test edit ($20). Finalists move to a 2-week paid trial.



Growth: As the brand scales, your role and compensation have the potential to grow with us.



How to Apply

To be considered, you must start your message with the phrase "CUSTOMER FIRST."



Portfolio: Link to a folder/reel of your E-com Direct Response ads.



AI Stack: Which specific AI tools do you use to produce 5 minutes of footage daily?



Output Check: Confirm you are capable of delivering 5 minutes of finished footage per day and hitting 24–48 hour deadlines.



Availability: Confirm you are looking for a long-term, full-time commitment.



Pay Structure: Confirm you are comfortable with the $1,000/month fixed rate and the "Winning Ad" bonus structure.

title: Etsy Listing Admin
description:
About the Role

We are a growing Etsy Print-on-Demand business expanding our team and looking for a serious, detail-oriented Virtual Assistant (VA) to join us as an Etsy Listing Agent.

This is a long-term, stable role, not a short-term project. We are looking for someone who wants consistency, structure, and the opportunity to grow with a team.

You will work Monday–Friday (4 hours per day) during Pacific Time (PDT) business hours.



Why This Role Is Different

We operate with clear systems, structured workflows, and documented SOPs.

You will not be guessing.

You will not be designing.

You will not be left without guidance.

Our graphic designers create the designs.

 Your role is to take those designs and execute the listing process accurately and efficiently using our tools and systems.

If you thrive in structured environments and like following clean processes, this role is for you.



Key Responsibilities:

-Use 
 to create and manage Etsy listings

-Take completed designs from our design team and:

-Run them through our bulk mockup generator (Photoshop-based)

-Prepare listing images

-Upload and format listings on Etsy using Prelist

-Ensure accuracy in: Titles, Tags, Descriptions, Variations, Pricing

-Follow internal SOPs

-Maintain steady daily productivity



Daily Reporting Requirement:

-Report on Slack when you start your shift

-Report on Slack when you end your shift



You may ask questions anytime during your shift. A manager will be available to assist you.



Required Skills & Experience:

-Understanding of how the Etsy platform works

-Basic knowledge of Print-on-Demand workflow

-Basic understanding of Adobe Photoshop

 (No designing required — you just need to know how to navigate tools and use mockup-related functions)

-Strong attention to detail

-Ability to follow structured processes consistently

-Reliable internet connection

-Availability during Pacific Time hours





The Type of Person We’re Looking For:

-We care deeply about mindset and reliability.

You are:

- Extremely detail-oriented

- Comfortable following systems and SOPs

- Willing to ask questions when unsure

- Not someone who repeats the same mistake after correction

- Committed to improving and growing

- Ego-free and coachable



Mistakes happen; repeating the same mistake without improvement is not acceptable.

We are not looking for someone who knows everything.

We are looking for someone who is reliable, structured, and serious about long-term work.



Compensation:

Fixed monthly pay:
/month Depending on Experience



Monday–Friday

4 hours per day

Long-term opportunity

Performance-based increases and additional responsibilities may be offered to strong, consistent performers.



Growth Opportunity:

We are building a long-term team. Strong performers may grow into:

Senior Listing Agent

Listing Quality Control Lead

Operations Support Role

Store Optimization Assistant





If you prove yourself reliable and detail-oriented, there is room to grow within the company.



To Apply, Please Send:

1.Your resume

2.A short summary of:

Administrative work (data entry, file organization, listing management)

3.Any experience with:

-Etsy listing

-Print-on-Demand

-Photoshop (basic)

4.Your availability during PDT hours



Bonus points if you’ve worked as an Etsy Listing Agent before.



To be considered, use this exact subject line:

“I am the Etsy Listing Agent VA you are looking for!”

title: Ecommerce Growth Manager (Shopify & Klaviyo Expert)
description:
Role Overview  Position Filled

We are a legacy health and nutrition brand (Agape Nutrition) transitioning from a "supplement department store" to a "protocol-based authority." I am seeking a high-level Growth Manager to act as my "external brain" and project lead. You will be responsible for executing a structured roadmap in Smartsheet to move our revenue from $6k/month to our historical high of $40k/month.

Key Responsibilities

Shopify Optimization: Audit our store for mobile speed, remove non-essential apps, and restructure our navigation from "Categories" to "Solution-Based Protocols" (e.g., Gut Integrity, Neural Calm).

Klaviyo Management: Clean and segment a database of 18,000 profiles in Shopify. Build advanced automated flows (Welcome, Browse Abandonment, and Post-Purchase Support).

Data & Operations: Manage our 3000+ SKU inventory and customer lists via Google Sheets/CSV bulk edits.

Project Management: Update and maintain our Smartsheet Master Plan, providing weekly "Pulse Reports" so the Founder stays informed without being overwhelmed.

Requirements

Expert Mastery of Shopify and Klaviyo (Certification preferred).

Experience with Smartsheet or similar high-level project management tools.

Strategic Thinking: Ability to build product "bundles" and "pathways" similar to the Amy Myers or Thorne models.

Self-Starter: You must be able to work independently. I have limited energy for micromanagement; I need you to bring solutions, not just problems.



This is not an advisory position.  This is a I know what I am doing inside and out.  Review the site, use AI to help, and revise this store so it sells. This is not a newby job.  This is job for a Shopify Rockstar.  You will be responsible for turning this store around.  I have AI aided plans to help, but you not me will be doing the work and keeping me in the loop.  You do this well and you will be permently employed with a good salary and better bonuses.  But please it you don't have the skills don't waste your time and mine.  



List previous experience:



Please answer the following three questions in your application:



Our current conversion rate is 0.7%. What are the first 3 things you would check on our Shopify backend to fix this?



How would you handle a "cold" import list of 4,000 names in Klaviyo to avoid being marked as spam?



Are you comfortable using Smartsheet to track your own KPIs and report them to a Founder with limited tim

title: Bookeeper/Accountant
description:
We are looking for a detail-oriented and proactive Bookkeeper/Accountant who can go beyond basic bookkeeping. This role requires someone who can think strategically and help us understand, optimize, and grow our business financially — essentially acting as a CFO.



This is one of those roles where a formal degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field is strongly preferred. Strong written and spoken English skills are required.



Responsibilities:



Weekly Reporting:

- MRR (Monthly Recurring Revenue)

- New clients

- Churned clients

- Close rate

- Cost per call





Monthly Reporting:

- Cost to fulfill

- Marketing costs

- Revenue

- Reinvestment tracking

- Payroll

- Dividends

- Bank balances

- Maintain and organize financial records in QuickBooks

- Connect and reconcile receipts accurately inside QuickBooks

- Ensure all transactions are properly categorized and up to date





What We’re Looking For:

- Degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field 

- Strong experience in bookkeeping and accounting

- Advanced knowledge of QuickBooks

- Ability to generate clear, organized financial reports

- Strong analytical and critical thinking skills

- Excellent written and verbal English communication

- Proactive mindset, not just reporting numbers, but suggesting improvements





Strategic Expectations:

You should be able to:

- Identify opportunities to save money

- Recommend which metrics we should focus on

- Suggest areas of the business that need optimization

- Help guide financial decision-making



We’re not just looking for someone to “track numbers.” We’re looking for someone who understands them and can help us use them to grow.



If you’re organized, strategic, and comfortable taking ownership of financial performance, we’d love to hear from you.

title: GoHighLevel Performance Systems Manager
description:
We are looking for an experienced GoHighLevel professional to join our growing marketing agency and help us build advanced, scalable systems for our clients.This role is best suited for someone who has already worked hands-on with full GHL systems, automations, and workflows, and is confident operating independently.



If you are still learning the platform or are new to GoHighLevel, this may not be the right fit at this time.

How to Apply

-Please
: 

-Subject: GoHighLevel Specialist – Application



Your
 should begin with:

1. Experience Summary (First Paragraph – Required)

Please include:

-How many years you’ve worked with GoHighLevel

-How many client accounts you’ve managed

-Types of systems you’ve built (funnels, SaaS, agencies, clinics, etc.)

-Your strongest technical skills within GHL

-Applications missing this section may not be reviewed.



2. Verified Work & Portfolio (Required)

-Please provide links to examples of your work, such as:

-Live funnels or demo accounts

-Loom, Drive, or YouTube walkthroughs showing:

-Automations

-Workflows

-Pipelines

-Campaigns

-AI tools

-Websites or landing pages built in GHL

-This helps us better understand your experience and strengths.



3. AI & Automation Experience

Please share:

-How you currently use AI inside GoHighLevel

-Examples of AI-powered workflows

-Any external AI tools you’ve integrated (if applicable)



4. Systems & Integrations

-List any tools you’ve connected with GHL, such as:

-Stripe / Payment systems

-Zapier / Webhooks

-Calendars

-SMS &
 platforms

-CRMs

-APIs



5. Availability & Long-Term Commitment

Please confirm:

-You are available full-time

-You can work within PST hours

-You are interested in a long-term role



6. Learning & Problem-Solving Example

-Share one example where you learned a complex system quickly and successfully delivered results.



Our Goal

We work with high-level clients and focus on building reliable, long-term systems. We value professionalism, strong communication, and consistency. We’re excited to connect with candidates who are passionate about systems, automation, and delivering quality work.

title: Remote Assistant Video Editor (DaVinci Resolve Required)
description:
Remote Assistant Video Editor (DaVinci Resolve Required)



Description: 

Ongoing, Per-Project Basis With Long-Term Opportunity

Competitive Pay Based on Experience & Reliability



We are a US commercial production company hiring an experienced DaVinci Resolve editor to support high-volume, interview-driven brand content (Brand Stories, Testimonials, Services, Facility Tours, Short-Form, Podcasts).



This is not entry level. Professional client experience required.



You Must:

• Be highly proficient in DaVinci Resolve

• Sync multicam + external audio cleanly

• Maintain strict project organization (bins, naming, timelines)

• Build structured rough cuts and polished timelines for senior editors

• Deliver within 7 days of footage upload

• Communicate clearly and meet deadlines

• Handle multiple simultaneous deliverables



Sloppy timelines or missed deadlines without communication will not be accepted.

We hold 1–2 brief weekly check-ins as needed.



Requirements

• Professional portfolio (brand/client work only)

• 2+ years experience preferred

• Strong file management habits

• Reliable high-speed internet

• Comfortable using AI tools for workflow efficiency



ONLY ACCEPTING APPLICATIONS INCLUDING:

Resume

Portfolio

1–2 interview edits

Confirm you edit in DaVinci Resolve

Confirm availability

Internet speed screenshot

Include “ResolveReady” in subject line

title: Short-Form Content Editor (Business / Educational Brand | Long-Term)
description:
ABOUT THE ROLE



I run a growing online education and AI-focused business brand.



This is not a basic cutting job.



I’m looking for a content editor who understands retention, authority, and brand perception.



Your job is to help turn raw recordings into engaging content that builds trust and makes people watch until the end.



This is a long-term opportunity with room to grow into larger projects as the brand scales.



WHAT YOU WILL BE EDITING (PRIMARY FOCUS)



• 30 to 90 second Instagram Reels

• TikToks

• YouTube Shorts

• Talking-head content

• Screen recordings (tutorials, AI demos)



Style:



• Fast cuts

• Strong hooks

• Burned-in captions with emphasis

• Zooms and punch-ins

• Strategic b-roll

• Clean pacing with no dead space



Your mission: prevent the scroll.



FUTURE CONTENT EXPANSION (AS THE BRAND GROWS)



As the brand scales, we will expand into higher-level assets. You should be comfortable growing into these areas:



Carousel Posts



These must look clean, branded, and consistent.

Strong typography, layout design, and visual hierarchy matter.

Carousels are not “slides.” They are conversion tools.



YouTube Long-Form



Pacing, transitions, music, b-roll, sound design.

This is where credibility is built.

Amateur editing kills authority instantly.



Landing Page / VSL (Video Sales Letter)



This is one of the most important videos in the business.

It must be tight, structured, persuasive, and professionally edited.

Audio clarity, visuals, and pacing are critical.



Paid Ad Creatives (When Launched)



Short-form direct response videos optimized for performance.

Hook-driven, attention-first editing.



If you only want to edit basic TikToks forever, this role is not for you.



RESPONSIBILITIES



• Edit daily short-form content

• Improve retention and pacing

• Add captions and emphasis

• Suggest stronger hooks when needed

• Deliver platform-ready vertical files

• Maintain consistency in style and branding



REQUIRED SKILLS



You must have:



• Experience editing short-form business content

• Understanding of retention psychology

• Strong English comprehension

• Reliability and fast communication

• Ability to follow instructions precisely

• Consistent availability



Software:

Premiere Pro, Final Cut, or advanced CapCut



THIS ROLE IS NOT FOR YOU IF



• You only edit gaming montages or wedding videos

• You rely entirely on templates

• You disappear or miss deadlines

• You need constant supervision



Reliability > raw creativity.



TRIAL PROCESS



Shortlisted applicants will receive:



• A 45 to 60 second raw clip

• Clear editing instructions

• 24 hours to deliver



HOW TO APPLY



Follow ALL instructions or your application will be ignored.



Put the word RETENTION at the top of your message.



Send ONLY 3 of your best short-form edits.



Include your computer specs and internet speed.



Tell me your availability.



Answer these:



• What makes a short video keep attention?

• What is the most important part of the first 5 seconds?

• If viewers drop off at 8 seconds, what would you change?



Applications that do not follow instructions will not be reviewed.

title: Virtual Assistant – Customer Service and Job Scheduling (Full-Time)
description:
*MUST BE WILLING TO LEARN HOUSECALL PRO*

We are looking for a long-term, reliable Virtual Assistant to become a key part of our business operations. This role is full-time and involves a variety of important administrative and support tasks, with a focus on keeping everything running smoothly day to day.



Your Responsibilities Will Include



Job & Schedule Management: Assigning jobs to cleaners/technicians via Housecall Pro and updating daily schedules.



Payroll: Using Calculate sales rep and employee payroll and daily P/L sheets.



Customer Support & Payments: Responding to inquiries, following up with customers, and reconciling payments to ensure all accounts are up to date.



Payroll & Commissions: Preparing weekly payroll and commission calculations for our team.



Accounts & Reporting: Tracking paid vs unpaid jobs, updating spreadsheets, and providing weekly reports (KPIs, leaderboards, profit/loss sheets).



General Admin:
 management, research, and other day-to-day administrative support.



Work Hours

About 10 hours per day, 6 days per week



8:30am – 6pm EST



Some days will be busy with multiple tasks; other days will be lighter, mainly monitoring schedules, reconciling payments, or being available for quick updates.



Requirements

Strong English communication skills (written & verbal)

Willingness to Learn Housecall Pro



Reliable laptop and stable internet connection



Experience with admin tools (CRMs, — training can be provided)



Organized, detail-oriented, and proactive



Trustworthy and committed to long-term work



Compensation



$4 USD per hour



Paid weekly or bi-weekly (depending on your preference)



Opportunity for salary increases based on performance and reliability



Perks



Long-term, stable role with growth potential



Direct work with the company owner (your input will be valued)



Flexible culture — as long as tasks are completed and you remain responsive, the workload will often feel balanced and manageable

title: Online Math/Science Teacher(Near-Native Accent)
description:
About Pomelo Academy

Pomelo Academy is an innovative online international school dedicated to delivering high-quality education to students worldwide. We provide a dynamic and engaging learning environment, catering to individualized instruction that transcends geographical boundaries.



Job Description

We are seeking passionate and experienced Near-Native English-speaking Online K-12 Math and/or Science Teachers with verifiable teaching certifications. The ideal candidates will have strong academic backgrounds in Mathematics and/or Science, experience teaching young learners (ages 5–18), and a commitment to creating a supportive, inquiry-based, and engaging online learning environment.



Responsibilities



Deliver interactive and engaging Math and/or Science lessons to individuals and small groups of 2–6 students aged 5–18.

Teach using internationally recognized curricula such as A Closer Look, Glencoe Science, Pearson Interactive Science, NGSS-aligned resources, Singapore Math, or IB/AP/A Level Math programs.

Create age-appropriate lesson plans focused on conceptual understanding, inquiry, problem-solving, and real-world applications.

Incorporate visuals, multimedia, and hands-on virtual activities to make abstract concepts accessible and engaging.

Monitor student progress and provide timely feedback to students and parents.

Foster curiosity, discussion, and active learning in a safe and supportive space.



Qualifications



Professional teacher with at least 2 years of teaching experience (Kindergarten–Grade 12).

Must hold a valid teaching license/certification (e.g., Teaching License, State Certification). TESOL/TEFL is a plus.

Near-native English accent with excellent spoken and written communication skills.

Strong academic background in Mathematics and/or Science (Biology, Physics, Chemistry, General Science).

Experience teaching in public/international schools or reputable online platforms.

Familiarity with inquiry-based and/or interdisciplinary approaches (e.g., STEM/STEAM).

Comfortable working between 07:00–22:00 (Weekdays) and 9:00–22:00 (Weekends), GMT+8.

Proficiency with digital platforms such as ClassIn, Microsoft Office, and other educational technologies.

Must have a stable and fast internet connection and a PC/laptop with at least Windows 10 or Mac OS Catalina.



Benefits



Flexible working hours.

Opportunity to teach using globally respected Math and Science curricula.

Be part of an international, passionate team of educators.

Access to training and professional development.

Regular enrollment model (not a booking system), ensuring schedule stability and consistency

title: We Are Hiring: Elite Parabroker / Mortgage Credit Analyst (Philippines) High-Performance Role
description:
Elite Parabroker (Philippines) – High-Performance Mortgage Brokerage (AU)



High-Performance Role | Australian Hours | Full-Time | Immediate Start



________________________________________

THE INTRO

We’re looking for a high-accuracy, high-ownership Parabroker who thrives in a fast-paced brokerage, can make smart credit decisions, and produces flawless work.



If you have real parabroking experience, can complete serviceability assessments, understand credit policy, and can own a file from onboarding ? strategy ? submission ? settlement, then keep reading — this might be the best role you’ve ever had.



Please read all the way to the end for the specific details on how to apply. Only those who follow the instructions entirely will be considered.

________________________________________

THE ROLE



Purpose & Outcomes



Your job isn't simple for most but is important:

Help the broker settle more loans with fewer mistakes, faster turnaround times, and elite-level execution.



You will be responsible for handling deals from onboarding to approval, providing strategic credit analysis, structuring deals based on handover notes, and ensuring submissions are clean, complete, and positioned for approval.



When you do your job well:

• We close more deals

• Our clients have a smoother experience

• You directly drive performance, growth & revenue

________________________________________

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES



1. Onboarding

• Review & identify incomplete client files

• Follow up clients for missing documents

• Download organise and rename documents

• Complete document checklists

• Transfer all necessary data into CRM

• Call and
 clients for outstanding items



2. Strategy Preparation

• Full credit analysis

• Deep policy research across lenders

• Liaise strategically with BDMs & lender support to ensure clients circumstances are accepted

• Identify approval pathways & deal solutions. Every possible flaw in the deal should be identified and a solution verified.

• Document and organise outcomes clearly with speed.

• Structure loans based on handover notes (LVR, splits, closing costs, client contributions, selecting correct loan types, deductibility vs non deductibility and much more).

• Conduct detailed and accurate serviceability calculations (PAYG, Self-Employed, Pension etc.)

• Review liabilities, living expenses, credit reports, bank statements & Illion data

• Complete lender comparisons.

• Complete a well organised handover detailing the results and clear path for approval.



3. Submission / Lodgement

• Understand lender input nuances

• Upload only correct & relevant documents

• Drafting strong broker notes explaining all nuances of the deal and solutions for them.

• Position the loan for approval only.

• Send docs for e-signing & follow up clients

• Maintain 
ntum to formal approval



4. MIRs (Missing Information Requests)

• Action MIRs same day as they arrive.

• Challenge incorrect MIRs using policy + evidence.

• Ensure information provided aligns with the narrative of the application before sending.

• Communicate required items to clients in a simple, non-overwhelming manner

• Prepare forms & documents to minimise client effort



5. Settlement

• Send formal approvals to client & solicitor

• Coordinate insurance (certificate of currency)

• Confirm settlement booking

• Send final settlement letter/email to client



6. Workflow + Project Work

• Update and improve workflows

• Assist with monthly broker projects

• Update spreadsheets (tracking, referral partners, contacts, continuous improvement)

________________________________________

ABOUT YOU



We hire for capacity, precision, and genuine ownership.



You MUST Have:

• Strong parabroking experience

• Strong ability to work with numbers

• Ability to process and retain large amounts of information

• Ability to complete serviceability assessments accurately

• Strong credit analysis ability

• Exceptional communication (written + verbal)

• Proactive problem-solving

• Resourcefulness — you find answers, not roadblocks

• Speed + accuracy

• Ability to produce clean, complete, well-reasoned deal files

• High quality hardware to perform your role- computer/laptop with large screen, at least one additional screen, reliable high speed internet.



Ideal (Bonus Points):

• 5+ years experience as a parabroker

• Experience with Australian mortgage aggregation software MYCRM

• Expert in using Quickly

• Immediate availability



You Are NOT a Fit If You:

• Are not competent and confident in performing the tasks outlined above

• Are slow and reactive

• Require micromanagement

• Don't prioritise your career

• Are not growth focused

• Get overwhelmed easily

• Struggle with communication

• Have anxious or low-confidence communication energy

• Cannot work to high standards under pressure

________________________________________

THE BENEFITS



Compensation

• AUD $1,700 – $2,000 per month (depending on skill level & experience)

• Monthly bonuses based on volumes & $ settled

• Overtime available

• Opportunity for travel experiences for high performers.



Work Hours

• Australian Business Hours

8:30am – 5:30pm AEST (Philippines: approx. 6:30am – 3:30pm)

• Monday - Friday

• Occasional flexibility for consistently reliable tea
mbers.



Employment Type

• Work from home arrangement

• Long-term

• Independent Contractor

• Fully integrated into our team



Growth & Career Development

• Advanced credit strategy experience

• Exposure to complex deals

• Work directly with a high-performance broker

• Grow as we grow

• Own your role, own your life

• Increase your value, income and long-term opportunities

________________________________________

OUR COMPANY



Who We Are

We are a high-performance Australian mortgage brokerage that closes a large volume of deals with precision and speed. We work fast, think strategically, and expect excellence — because our clients and partners rely on us for outcomes, not excuses.



Our Culture

• Fast execution

• High standards

• Clear communication

• Zero-drama, zero-ego team

• Growth-driven environment

• Accountability + ownership

• Young, motivated, conciouse, high-energy team



Our Mission

To deliver elite-level finance outcomes for clients while building a world-class team (that’s you) and scaling our operations with precision.

________________________________________

THE APPLICATION



Step 1 — Apply With the Following (All Required, Details Matter):

 your application to: 

Subject line: “Application – Parabroker (Philippines) – [Your Full Name]”

Include:

1. Attachment # 1 - Your resume

2. Attachment # 2 - A short cover letter (max 150 words)

• Why you want this role

• Your parabroking experience

• Why you believe you're high-performance

3. Attachment # 3 - A short audio (1–2 min)

• Introduce yourself

• Describe a deal you helped solve and how you can help solve deals with us.



Step 2 — Skills Screening

If shortlisted, you will complete:

• A serviceability assessment test

• A credit-analysis scenario

• A loan structuring test

• A communication test (written)



Step 3 — Interview

If you pass the elite test and deemed to be world class you'll have a much more relaxed video interview with our broker.



Start Date

ASAP after screening process. Do your best and we'll see you at the top

title: Technical Support Specialist (Open to Fresh Graduates)
description:
***APPLICATIONS FROM FRESH IT OR COMPUTER SCIENCE GRADUATES WITH BASIC CODING KNOWLEDGE WILL BE GIVEN PRIORITY***



APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS:

1. Add “TECHNICAL” to your subject line when applying

2. Submit a short cover letter along with a link to your CV/Resume



***WE WILL ONLY REVIEW APPLICATIONS THAT INCLUDE A CV/RESUME***



We’re adding a Technical Support Specialist to our remote team to help support our internal tools and user environment. This role focuses on troubleshooting issues, answering technical questions, and providing clear, practical guidance while maintaining a professional and helpful approach.



You’ll work closely with our team to ensure requests are handled efficiently and users receive reliable support. Training and guidance will be provided as you grow into the role.



What You’ll Work On:

Respond to incoming support requests through our internal channels



Troubleshoot technical concerns and provide clear solutions



Understand each user’s situation to deliver thoughtful and relevant support

Who this Role is For: 

Excellent English communication skills — verbal, written, and reading



IT or Computer Science background, or basic familiarity with coding (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, or similar)



Detail-oriented, proactive, and comfortable learning in a fast-moving environment



Strong research and problem-solving skills



Customer support experience is helpful but not required

Hours:

Full-time remote role



8 hours per day, 5 days per week



Additional workdays may occasionally be requested

title: Aurora to generate 3D site visuals
description:
I am looking for a "VA on steroids" who can create high-end technical infrastructure proposals. My previous designer used Aurora to generate 3D site visuals and bird’s-eye parcel views, and I need someone who can match that exact technical capability.



The Job:



3D Site Visuals: You must be able to use Aurora (or high-end 3D rendering software) to create clean, professional bird’s-eye views of infrastructure sites.



Proposal Layout: Take those renderings and put them into a "Golden Era" Canva layout that looks like a high-end investment prospectus.



Financials: Turn project budgets and ROI data into clean, professional tables (matching the style of my previous workforce housing proposals).



Reliability: I move fast and work on sensitive projects. No ghosting.

Software: Must be proficient in Aurora (or similar site-modeling software) and Canva.



Portfolio: You MUST show examples of 3D site renderings/proposals you have built.



Communication: Quick responses are a must.



Subject Line: Use the word "BRIDGE" in your application.

title: Content Feedback Manager (Giving Feedback): $1,000–$1,200 USD START RATE
description:
Start rate: $800 a month + performance-based bonuses (TOTAL: $1,000–$1,200 a month)



Paid every two weeks via Wise.



ABOUT US







Young Publisher is an international digital marketing company working with content creators and online brands.



BENEFITS

- Full-time position: 8 hours daily, Monday-Friday; 40 hours a week

- Flexible schedule: Choose your own hours, as long as you show up for the daily meeting (MANDATORY)

- Stable income: Long-term role with regular, on-time payments

- Supportive team: Collaborative environment without micromanagement

- Growth path: Opportunities to increase responsibilities and earnings

- 100% remote: Work-from-home setup



TASKS



- Content & Client Feedback

- Review 30-60 short-form client videos (Instagram Reels, TikTok, YouTube Shorts) per day in our Slack feedback channel -before they are published

- Give constructive, actionable feedback on hooks (verbal/headline/visual), scripting, pacing, editing, and CTA, making sure each client knows exactly how to improve

- Cross-reference each piece of content with client niche, experience, and goals as outlined in their files

- Review previous feedback to ensure consistency and avoid contradictions

- Quality-control content ideas created by our Content Research Experts before delivery to the client, ensuring fit with niche, experience, and likely performance

- Oversee workload balance among Content Research Experts and make sure no one on the team is overloaded or underutilized

- Respond to client questions or tech issues in Slack within 24 hours

- Be tough but fair—only approve content that meets quality standards



Progress Tracking



- Complete daily End-of-Day (EOD) reports

- Attend daily tea
eting (mandatory, 3pm CET)

- Keep internal feedback and client progress records up to date



REQUIREMENTS (MUST-HAVE)

- C1+ English (written), with perfect grammar and clear, professional responses

- Significant experience creating or reviewing short-form content for Instagram Reels, TikTok, or YouTube Shorts

- Organized and detail-oriented

- Reliable internet and a quiet, professional home workspace

- Accountability mindset and deadline commitment

- Long-term commitment, eager to master a workflow and have direct impact on client success



IMPORTANT



- When recording a Loom video as part of your application:

- Camera must show your FACE & SCREEN

- Treat it as a LIVE interview with the Hiring Manager

- Have a professional background

- Have clear audio

- Wear business-casual attire



BONUS SKILLS (NOT REQUIRED)



- Experience supporting creators and social media beginners, especially ages 45+

- Familiarity with AI tools like ChatGPT, CapCut, etc.

- Strong understanding of trends/strategy for Instagram, TikTok, and YouTube Shorts



WHY JOIN US?



- Start rate: $800 a month + performance-based bonuses (TOTAL: $1,000–$1,200 a month once trained)

Note: Senior CFMs earn $1,500+ after 6–12 months.

- Performance bonuses: Up to $400+ additional monthly based on:

- Quality and clarity of feedback

- Task completion and consistency

- Teamwork and responsibility

- Payments: Twice per month via Wise, direct to your bank

- Tools access: All tools/software fully covered

- Work-life balance: No graveyard shifts

- Professional growth: Frequent feedback and advanced training



HOW TO APPLY



1: Message us on OnlineJobs.ph with "CFM" as the message title



2: Include ONLY the following in your message:



#1: Your CV.

#2: Your years of experience with short-form content.

#3: Your years of experience with content feedback or coaching.

#4: One sentence on why you're a good fit for this role.

#5: Your portfolio (including examples of your feedback or video/content work).



Note: Messages that do not follow this format will NOT be reviewed.



P.S. Young Publisher is the recruitment company. Successful candidates will work under Social Influence Consulting LLC.

title: Data Analyst & Automation Specialist
description:
Data Analyst & Automation Specialist (Remote)

Rate: $4 up to $8/hour (based on skills and experience)

Schedule: US Time Zone (PST) | Full-time Role



Do you like working from home?

Hate commuting?

Love turning messy data into clean, automated reports?



We’re looking for someone who can analyze data, spot trends, and automate reporting so leadership can review the previous day’s numbers quickly and clearly. If you’ve ever looked at a manual report and thought “This should be automated…” — this role is for you.



What you’ll do:

- Analyze daily performance data

- Automate reports (daily / weekly / monthly)

- Eliminate manual exports

- Build simple, clean dashboards

- Review previous-day data with leadership

title: Technical fire door specialist
description:
Location: Remote (Philippines-based candidates preferred)

Employment Type: Full
-Time

Company Overview: The Door Centre is a trusted leader in the door solutions industry, known for providing premium-quality doors, ironmongery, and comprehensive services. We are expanding our team and looking for an experienced Technical Detailed fire Door and Ironmongery Specialist who can support our projects remotely.



Job Overview:

We are seeking a highly skilled Technical Detailed fire Door and Ironmongery Specialist to join The Door Centre team remotely. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in technical detailing and specification of doors, including fire doors, and associated ironmongery. This role requires exceptional attention to detail, knowledge of industry standards, and the ability to provide expert support on various projects.



Key Responsibilities:



• Produce detailed technical drawings and specifications for doors and ironmongery using CAD software.

• Collaborate with project teams to ensure accurate technical specifications align with client and project requirements.

• Develop and maintain comprehensive door schedules, ironmongery sets, and related documentation.

• Provide expert advice on suitable door hardware, finishes, and solutions to meet project needs.

• Demonstrate in-depth knowledge of fire door regulations and ensure all specifications comply with relevant fire safety standards.

• Liaise with suppliers and manufacturers to verify product specifications, availability, and lead times.

• Support project teams with technical problem-solving and guidance throughout project lifecycles.

• Ensure all technical drawings and documents comply with industry standards, building codes, and company guidelines.

• Provide assistance to sales staff and confirming customers orders, along with sending quotations.



Qualifications:



• Bachelor’s degree in Architecture, Engineering, or a related field (preferred but not required).

• Minimum of 3 years of experience in technical detailing of doors and ironmongery, with specific experience in fire door specifications.

• Proficiency in CAD software (AutoCAD, Revit, or similar).

• Strong knowledge of door systems, hardware, and their applications.

• Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

• High attention to detail and strong problem-solving abilities.

• Ability to manage time effectively and meet deadlines while working remotely.



Preferred Skills:



• Familiarity with relevant standards, such as BS-8214, and EN-16034 standards.

• Experience working with bespoke or specialized door systems.

• Knowledge of construction methods and building materials.

• Proactive and self-motivated, with the ability to work independently in a remote setting.



Why Join The Door Centre?:



• Work with a leading company known for quality and innovation.

• Be part of a collaborative and supportive team.

• Flexible remote work arrangement.

• Competitive salary and opportunities for professional growth.



How to Apply:

If you are passionate about door and ironmongery detailing, have knowledge of fire door specifications, and want to contribute your expertise remotely, please submit your resume, a cover letter outlining your experience, and a portfolio of relevant technical work to 



Please include “Remote Technical Detail Door and Ironmongery Specialist Application” in the subject line.



This updated job specification includes a requirement for expertise in fire doors, emphasizing compliance with relevant fire safety standards.

s

Equipment and Workspace Requirements

Internet Connection: A dedicated Fibre optic connection is mandatory, providing a minimum speed of 20 Mbps synchronous (upload and download) and a latency below 250 milliseconds. Wi-Fi and LTE connections are strictly prohibited.

title: Amazon Product Researcher (Online & Retail Arbitrage)
description:
About Us

We are a growing ecommerce business focused on profitable online and retail arbitrage on the Canadian Amazon marketplace. Our goal is to consistently source high-margin products and build a scalable operation. We are seeking a detail-oriented, analytical, and proactive Product Researcher to help uncover winning opportunities.



Position Overview

As an Amazon Product Researcher, you will be responsible for finding products with strong resale profitability on Amazon Canada. This is a results-driven role — your research directly impacts revenue.

You will work independently using tools such as Keepa and RevSeller to analyze product viability, pricing history, sales performance, and competitive landscape. The role offers flexible hours, allowing you to work when it suits you.



Key Responsibilities

*Conduct product research for online and retail arbitrage

*Analyze pricing history and sales velocity using Keepa

*Evaluate product profitability and ROI using RevSeller

*Screen products for eligibility and compliance with Amazon policies

*Accurately match products between supplier websites and Amazon listings

*Report findings clearly by entering complete and accurate data into Google Sheets

*Communicate progress, issues, and questions clearly via chat/email and regular check-ins



Mandatory Requirements

? Fluent or proficient in written and spoken English

 ? Fast, stable internet connection and a reliable computer

 ? Proven experience with Amazon product research for arbitrage

 ? Strong ability to accurately match products between suppliers and Amazon

 ? Comfortable using Keepa and RevSeller

 ? Ability to analyze ROI, sales rank, pricing history, and competition

 ? Strong analytical skills and exceptional attention to detail

 ? Ability to work independently and manage time effectively

 ? Willingness to learn quickly and take feedback seriously



Nice to Have

? Familiarity with Canadian marketplace nuances, including pricing differences, seasonal trends, stock availability, and common retail/online sources



Salary & Hours

*Starting at $3–$5 USD per hour (part-time)

*Rate depends on experience and performance

*5-hour paid trial period during the first week

*10 hours/week guaranteed after successful completion of the trial

*Opportunity for rate increases and transition to full-time based on results



What You’ll Get

? Fully remote role

? Flexible work schedule

? Guaranteed hours after trial period

? Performance-based growth opportunities

? Supportive, long-term collaboration



How to Apply

*Please submit the following:

-Your CV/Resume

-A short introduction describing your Amazon product research experience

-A brief list of tools you’ve used

-Examples of past product leads you’ve sourced



In your application
, start your message with the word “Maple” so we know you read the full job post.



NOTE: You will be asked to complete a short sample task. Successful completion is required before being offered a role.



Application subject line:

 Amazon Product Research VA – [Your Name]



Optional (but a big plus):

 Include a short 1–3 minute video introducing yourself and explaining your Amazon VA experience.



We are looking for someone who wants to grow with us long-term. If you are detail-oriented, comfortable with numbers, and experienced in Amazon product research, we would love to hear from you.

title: Personal Cook and Assistant
description:
Personal Household Cook (Personal Chef)



Job Title: Personal Household Cook (Personal Chef)

Employment Type: Full-Time

Location: BGC, Metro Manila

Client Nationality: American

Accommodation: Stay-Out (staff quarters provided on-site for rest breaks, including shower, toilet, and rest area)

Schedule: Monday – Saturday, 8:00 AM – 6:00 PM (Breakfast ready by 9:00 AM)

Overtime: Occasional Saturday or Sunday evenings when guests are expected

Salary: To be discussed



About the Role:

We are looking for a reliable and experienced Personal Household Cook to prepare healthy, Western-style meals and support daily household needs related to food, basic supplies, and pet care. This role is ideal for someone who takes pride in cooking nutritious meals consistently, stays organized with shopping and ingredients, and is comfortable caring for a small dog.



Key Responsibilities:

Healthy Meal Preparation (Western-Style)

Prepare healthy Western-style meals using techniques such as steaming, air frying, oven baking, grilling, and light sautéing. Cook daily meals with consistency and well-balanced portioning. Maintain freshness and proper food storage, including labeling and organizing leftovers.



Meal Planning & Customization:

Build on the existing meal plan while suggesting new healthy recipes. Coordinate with the client to align meals with dietary preferences and any restrictions.



Grocery & Household Shopping Errands:

Purchase groceries and high-quality ingredients such as fresh produce, proteins, and health-conscious options. Run miscellaneous shopping errands as requested, including basic household items and quick pickups. Track inventory and maintain a running list for restocking.



Meal Presentation:

Ensure meals are clean, visually appealing, and properly served.



Kitchen Cleanliness & Organization:

Keep the kitchen clean and organized during and after cooking. Wash dishes used for cooking, wipe counters, clean cooking surfaces, and maintain organization of the pantry and fridge related to meal prep. Cleaning responsibilities are limited to kitchen and cooking areas only.



Dog Walking & Care:

Walk a small poodle twice daily, morning and afternoon. Provide full-time dog care when the employer is traveling, compensated at regular rate.



Key Requirements:

Fluent in English (Non-Negotiable): Must be fluent in both spoken and written English.

Healthy Western Cooking Experience: Proven experience preparing healthy Western dishes such as salads, baked dishes, steamed meals, air-fried meals, and grilled items.

Strong Meal Planning Ability: Able to propose meal ideas, rotate menus, and keep food choices healthy and varied.

Organized & Detail-Oriented: Capable of managing grocery lists, food storage, and kitchen upkeep independently.

Reliable & Professional: Punctual, consistent, and comfortable working in a private household setting.

Comfortable with Pets: Willing and able to walk and care for a small dog daily.

WHAT THIS ROLE ACTUALLY IS

 + Automation Systems

title: Email Marketing Manager (ECommerce) - Full Time, Remote
description:
We are looking for a strategic and performance-driven
 & SMS Marketing Manager to lead the charge in growing and optimizing our owned marketing channels. This role is key to delivering high-converting campaigns that drive customer engagement, retention, and revenue across our skincare and hair care product lines. You’ll turn customer insights into action, bringing value at every touchpoint while aligning messaging with product and brand goals.





Primary Duties and Responsibilities:

Own the strategy, execution, and optimization of all
 and SMS campaigns for multiple product lines (e.g., hair thinning shampoo, supplements, anti-aging SPF, and skin supplements).

A/B test subject lines, content, offers, and creative assets to continuously improve key performance metrics (CTR, open rate, CVR, revenue per send).

Monitor and report on campaign performance; adjust strategy based on insights and trends.

Build surveys and gather customer feedback to inform future content and product ideas.

Collaborate with creative, product, and customer experience teams to ensure consistent and on-brand messaging.

Maintain a strong understanding of compliance and best practices in
/SMS marketing (e.g., CAN-SPAM, TCPA).

Suggest and implement new technologies, tools, and tactics to stay ahead of the curve.





Qualifications:

3+ years of experience in
 and SMS marketing, ideally in eCommerce or beauty/wellness.

Expert in Klaviyo or similar marketing automation platforms.

Strong writing skills and a keen eye for visual branding and user experience.

Solid understanding of customer behavior, segmentation, and marketing psychology.

Results-oriented with a deep passion for data, testing, and optimization.

Familiarity with tools like Rebuy or product recommendation engines is a plus.

Proactive, curious, and comfortable working in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.

Passion for skincare, wellness, and helping people feel their best.





What You’ll Help Shape:



Your role goes beyond sending campaigns—you’ll help us build smarter customer journeys by listening to our audience. You'll turn feedback into better product launches, sharper messaging, and a stronger brand voice. You’re part marketer, part strategist, part customer advocate.

 listing size:

About Us



Ennovation Brands, the parent company of Skin Research Institute (SRI), is dedicated to creating innovative, science-backed beauty and wellness products that deliver real results. title: Creative Video Editor (E-commerce and Social Media) - Remote
description:
Job Summary:



We are looking for a highly skilled and creative Video Editor who excels at transforming raw clips and creative concepts into engaging, high-converting video content for social media ads and Amazon product videos.



This role requires more than just technical proficiency—it demands a strong storytelling ability, a deep understanding of e-commerce video trends, and the ability to craft videos that capture and hold attention with minimal supervision. As Mr. Beast says, "the magic happens in the editing room"—your work will be the d

Primary Duties and Responsibilities:

, Instagram, TikTok, and YouTube.

Manage multiple projects while maintaining quality and meeting deadlines in a fast-paced environment.

Qualifications:



Proven experience as a Video Editor, preferably in e-commerce, social media marketing, or DTC brands.

Expert-level proficiency in Adobe Premiere Pro, After Effects, Final Cut Pro, or similar editing software.

Strong understanding of social media ad formats, aspect ratios, and platform-specific video requirements.

Ability to edit fast-paced, attention-grabbing content optimized for conversions.

Exceptional storytelling skills—knowing how to keep viewers engaged from start to finish.

Experience with motion graphics, text animation, and sound design to enhance engagement.

Ability to work independently and take creative direction, producing high-quality content with minimal supervision.

Preferred Qualifications:



Experience editing videos for beauty, health, or lifestyle brands.

Knowledge of A/B testing for video ads and performance optimization strategies.

Familiarity with Amazon product video guidelines and best practices.

Basic skills in color grading, lighting correction, and sound mixing.

About Us:



Skin Research Institute is a fast-growing e-commerce brand dedicated to creating high-quality beauty and wellness products. Our marketing team thrives on delivering compelling, high-performing video content that resonates with our audience and drives sales.



Learn more about us:

Let’s create standout content together!

title: Dispatch & Logistics Specialist
description:
We're currently looking to hire a Dispatch & Logistics Specialist (Operations Specialist) to support a fast-growing operations and logistics platform that powers real-world & on the ground operations (e.g., delivery robots, on-demand moving boxes, etc.) and high-volume brand event activations across the United States. 



This role is for someone who can stay calm in high-stakes, time-sensitive 
nts and keep many moving parts on track - shipments, work orders, drivers, inventory, and on-the-ground operators. You'll act as a human "dispatch + monitoring" layer: looking ahead, catching issues early, and coordinating fixes when plans change. 



You’ll work closely with the core operations and project teams to ensure every job is executed correctly - especially during weekends, early mornings, and other peak periods. If you like triage, coordination, and making sure nothing falls through the cracks, this role is for you. 



Responsibilities:

- Monitor daily and weekend operations (often starting early) to confirm critical tasks are acknowledged and executed on time (e.g., truck arrivals, pickups, deliveries, event milestones).

- Coordinate with network operators, warehouse partners, and on-site teams to ensure inventory is received, quality-checked, counted, and staged for upcoming deployments and events.

- Track inbound and outbound shipments (pallets + parcels), resolve exceptions, and verify that inventory is in the correct place at the correct time.

- Dispatch and coordinate transportation as needed (e.g., routing a driver, arranging trucks/U-Hauls, confirming pickup/drop-off windows).

- Serve as the first line of escalation when last-minute changes occur — identify the issue, communicate clearly, and drive it to resolution.

- Maintain accurate updates in internal tools (work orders, inventory systems, trackers) so stakeholders have a single source of truth.

- Provide proactive look-ahead support by reviewing upcoming schedules and deliveries to prevent problems before they happen.

- Collaborate with operations leadership and the product/engineering team by sharing on-the-ground feedback to improve workflows, tooling, and automation.

- Create and improve SOPs/checklists and help standardize best practices as the business scales.



Requirements:

- 3+ years experience in operations, logistics, dispatch, 3PL/warehouse coordination, or on-demand staffing operations (or equivalent).

- Hands-on experience coordinating time-sensitive work where “you can’t drop the ball” (e.g., day-of event logistics, last-mile operations, staffing dispatch, fleet ops).

- Comfortable working weekends as needed to support live operations.

- Strong written and verbal communication — able to keep multiple stakeholders aligned in fast-moving situations via calls,  texts, chats,
s, or other platforms.

- Highly organized with excellent attention to detail; able to multitask without losing accuracy.

- Proficient with common ops tools (Google Workspace/Excel, Slack, Airtable, Notion, Asana, etc.) and able to learn new systems quickly (inventory/work-order platforms, CRMs, ticketing tools).

- Self-starter mindset: asks questions, takes ownership, and continuously improves processes.



Salary and Benefits:

- Base salary: 55,000 PHP per month

- 100% remote / work-from-home

- Flexible work arrangements with a supportive team

- Opportunity to grow with a scaling operations business and take on increasing responsibility



When applying, send your resume link, explain why you're a good fit. Also copy and paste this Job ID: rec3k2P8qsKXsE0Ya into your
 response, along with this message: “I’m excited to be applying to Job ID:rec3k2P8qsKXsE0Ya!” This will let us know what job you’re applying for as well as show us that you actually read this entire job description (attention to detail is everything). Thanks and hope to hear from you soon!

title: Generative AI Trainer
description:
We’re on the lookout for a Generative AI Trainer to help us collect, structure, and validate mechanical component data for our early-stage AI company. In this role, you’ll work on building an intelligent agent that performs foundational mechanical design work for industrial systems, including data center electrical and cooling infrastructure. Plus, you’ll collaborate with a supportive team while contributing to process improvements in our AI data pipelines.



We’re looking for someone who loves research, thrives in spreadsheets, and enjoys turning messy technical data into clean, structured datasets. You’ll need to be comfortable using AI tools daily, handling large volumes of data, and performing quality checks to ensure accuracy. This role is research-driven, fast-paced, and requires precision—you’ll help power the AI system that’s at the heart of our operations.



Above all, we need someone self-motivated, detail-oriented, and able to work independently while collaborating with the team asynchronously. If this sounds like the challenge you’re looking for, we’d love to hear from you!



Responsibilities:

- Research industrial mechanical and electrical components (terminal boxes, lugs, fuses, wires, enclosures, compressors, etc.)

- Locate manufacturer data sheets and technical documentation online

- Extract detailed specifications from PDFs and other technical documents

- Use AI tools (e.g., Claude, ChatGPT, or other extraction tools) to scrape, structure, and reformat data

- Reformat messy documentation into clean, structured datasets

- Validate AI outputs for correctness and completeness

- Organize all data in Google Sheets and structured catalogs, maintaining consistency in formatting and categorization

- Cross-reference data between sheets and prepare clean datasets for AI training and analysis

- Perform QA checks to ensure accuracy before data enters the AI training pipeline

- Work within a structured team workflow with research assignments

- Participate in cross-team QA reviews

- Communicate clearly and asynchronously with the team

- Contribute ideas for improving processes, speed, and efficiency

- Work in short, rapid cycles (1–2 day turnaround targets per component category)

- Focus on delivering structured, high-quality output efficiently while adapting quickly as priorities evolve



Requirements:

- 5+ years of experience in BPO Customer Support, Operations, or Documentation Management, especially with US-based businesses.

- Experience working at a US-based startup is a major plus!

- Exceptional research skills and ability to find accurate technical information efficiently

- Extremely detail-oriented and comfortable working with technical specs and numbers

- Strong Google Sheets proficiency (formulas, cross-sheet referencing, data organization)

- Comfortable handling large datasets across multiple files

- Regular user of AI tools and curious about improving workflows

- Strong written communication skills

- Self-starter who works independently but collaborates effectively

- Comfortable asking questions and clarifying ambiguity

- Fast learner who can absorb processes quickly

- Comfortable working in a remote, async-first team



Bonus (Not Required):

- Exposure to mechanical, electrical, or industrial systems

- Experience working with technical documentation or engineering data

- Previous AI training, AI ops, or data structuring experience

- Experience handling structured product catalogs.



Salary and Benefits:

- Base salary: 55k PHP per month.

- Paid Time Off + Paid Holidays.

- 100% WFH.

- Flexible work arrangements and supportive team environment.



When applying, send your resume link, explain why you're a good fit. Also copy and paste this Job ID: recVi9bgoKW7Hdwyg into your
 response, along with this message: “I’m excited to be applying to Job ID:recVi9bgoKW7Hdwyg!” This will let us know what job you’re applying for as well as show us that you actually read this entire job description (attention to detail is everything). Thanks and hope to hear from you soon!

title: Remote Accounting & U.S. Tax Concierge
description:

Employment Type: Full-Time | Remote

A growing accounting firm specializing in bookkeeping, accounting, and U.S. tax compliance. We provide accurate, reliable, and client-focused financial services to local and international clients.

Position Summary:

We are seeking a detail-oriented and client-focused Accounting & U.S. Tax Concierge to join our remote team. This role serves as the first point of contact for clients while also supporting the accounting and U.S. tax team with administrative, bookkeeping, and compliance-related tasks. The ideal candidate has experience in accounting and basic knowledge of U.S. taxation.



Key Responsibilities:

Serve as the primary contact for client inquiries via
, phone, and virtual meetings

Manage appointment scheduling and maintain team calendars
