title: Home Care Recruiter
description:
About Us



At Helper Heroes, we’re on a mission to provide exceptional care and support to home care agencies in America. We believe in creating a true partnership where our employees act and feel like a true member of the American team they are matched with. Our goal is to help them create a compassionate, innovative, and efficient care experience for their clients and their families. To achieve this, we’re looking for a Helper Hero to join our team and help us shine even brighter!



About You



What sets us apart is YOU. You’re not just any virtual tea
mber—you’re a Helper Hero! If you’re passionate about making a difference, have a knack for organization, and thrive in a fast-paced, mission-driven environment, you’re who we are looking for. If you’re the kind of person who loves tackling behind-the-scenes tasks with a smile, ensuring that our clients' caregivers and clients receive the best possible support, apply today!



Job Overview



We are seeking a proactive, detail-oriented Recruiter to support recruitment, caregiver

onboarding, and administrative tasks for a growing home care business. This role is

ideal for someone with experience in healthcare recruitment and a passion for

streamlining operations. You will work closely with the owner to alleviate their workload,

enabling them to focus on business growth and client care.



Key Responsibilities



1. Recruitment & Onboarding:



- Manage end-to-end caregiver recruitment: screen applicants, schedule interviews, and coordinate orientation/training.

- Process onboarding documentation via ADP Workforce (e.g., electronic I-9s, employee handbook distribution).

- Track and ensure completion of state-mandated caregiver training (e.g.,via Active Insights).



2. Administrative Support



- Answer inbound calls during peak hours and manage voi
s/lead inquiries.

- Assist with client intake calls and referral source coordination.

- Provide general administrative support (e.g., scheduling, data entry).



3. Systems & Collaboration



- Utilize platforms like WellSky or Axiscare (training provided) to streamline workflows.

- Collaborate with the owner to refine processes and maintain organization.



Qualifications:



- Excellent written/verbal communication (fluent English).

- Strong organizational and time-management abilities.

- Proficiency with CRM systems,
 management, and cloud-based tools (e.g., Google Drive).

- Proactive mindset—anticipate needs before they arise.

- Proven experience in recruitment, preferably in healthcare or home care staffing.

- Strong interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to build rapport with candidates and tea
mbers.

- Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.

- Ability to work independently and manage time effectively in a fast-paced environment.

- Familiarity with recruitment platforms and CRM tools

- A positive attitude, sense of humor, and a passion for helping others.



Attributes of a Successful Helper Hero:



- Empathy: You genuinely care about people and want to make a difference in their lives.

- Organization: You’re a master of multitasking and can keep everything running smoothly.

- Communication: You speak impeccable English. You’re a clear and friendly communicator, both written and verbal.

- Problem Solver: You can see the big picture when resolving complex issues and follow through until you reach full resolution.

- Self Starter: You work effectively without supervision and follow processes precisely.

- Reliability: You’re dependable, punctual, and always ready to step up when needed.



Why You’ll Love Working with Us:



- ???? Competitive Base Pay: $6.50/hr for the first 6 months. (Among the highest in the homecare industry)

- Make a Difference: You’ll play a key role in ensuring that clients receive the best

care possible.

- Growth Opportunities: As we grow, so will you! There’s plenty of room for

advancement and learning.

- Fun & Supportive Team: We’re a tight-knit group that values collaboration,

compassion, and a good laugh.



Ready to Be a Hero?



If you’re excited about the opportunity to join our team, where you’ll be appreciated,

have a sense of purpose and inclusion and are willing to help us create a brighter, more

compassionate care experience, we can’t wait to hear from you! Apply today and let’s

make a difference together.



IMPORTANT:  Directly apply and send your resume on our website

title: Viral Music Social Media Strategist (AI-Driven Creative Project)
description:

Ideal Candidate Profile

• Has managed or grown social media accounts

Compensation

$300/month starting base

Performance-based raises

Long-term growth opportunity for high performers

This role requires consistency, confidentiality, and measurable output.

description:

We are a fast-growing Canadian real estate team looking for a professional appointment setter to call our inbound and outbound leads. This is NOT a casual VA role. This is a results-driven calling position.

s and text messages from buyers and sellers

>> Work Schedule

Consistent schedule required



>> Pay Structure

Base pay: $5-7 CAD/hour (based on experience)

Bonuses per qualified appointment booked

Performance-based raises for strong results

title: Full Time Remote Customer Support Assistant
description:
We are building a distributed support team and are looking for a Customer Support Assistant who takes written communication seriously and values consistency in their work. This is a full-time remote position designed for someone who wants dependable income, clear expectations, and the chance to grow within a structured environment over time.



This role is not project-based or temporary. We are looking for someone who wants stability, is comfortable working set hours, and understands that strong support is built on reliability and attention to detail.



You will spend your workday handling customer conversations through written messages. Your responsibility is to provide clear, accurate, and professional responses while maintaining a friendly tone. You will work within defined guidelines, manage several conversations at the same time, and ensure users receive timely and helpful replies. Part of the role also involves flagging recurring issues, technical problems, or useful feedback so the team can improve processes and systems.

Full onboarding and training are provided before you begin working independently.



This role requires strong written English and a typing speed of at least 60 words per minute. You must have a reliable internet connection of 50-100 Mbps or higher. A dependable laptop or desktop computer with at least 8 GB of RAM is required.



You should be available full-time for a consistent schedule of eight hours per day, six days per week. We value people who are detail-oriented, professional in their communication, dependable in meeting expectations, and open to feedback and improvement.



Previous experience in customer support, chat-based roles, or remote work is helpful but not required.



The hourly pay for this position ranges from 4 to 6 USD, depending on experience and performance.

In addition to base pay, there are performance-based bonuses, regular reviews, and opportunities for raises. Tea
mbers who consistently perform well can grow into higher-responsibility and higher-paying roles over time.



Why Join Us?

You’ll be working remotely in a structured environment with clear systems, training, and expectations. This role is ideal for someone who wants long-term stability rather than short-term gigs, and who values growth through consistent performance.



Apply now by sending us a message with all relevant information mentioned above and we look forward to having you!

title: RN - Insurance Verification
description:
We are seeking a Registered Nurse who understands that access to care is just as important as the care itself. As an RN on our Global Support Team, you will play a critical role in ensuring patients move seamlessly from referral to diagnosis and treatment by securing accurate insurance verification and prior authorizations. We are a high-volume, fast-paced sleep medicine practice, and this role sits at the center of protecting both the patient experience and the clinical workflow. If you are detail-oriented, organized, and confident navigating complex payer systems, this position offers meaningful impact every single day.



The RN – Insurance Verification will be responsible for verifying insurance eligibility and benefits for sleep-related diagnostic and therapeutic services, obtaining prior authorizations through payer portals and over the phone, and collaborating closely with physicians, advanced practice providers, and clinical teams to ensure documentation meets medical necessity requirements. This role requires proactive follow-up with insurance carriers, accurate EMR documentation, and the ability to identify and resolve authorization barriers before they delay patient care. Success in this position means minimizing denials, reducing treatment delays, and ensuring patients can move forward without unnecessary friction.



Applicants must hold an active, unrestricted RN license and have direct experience with insurance verification and prior authorizations. Strong familiarity with payer portals and phone-based authorization workflows is essential. Experience working within Availity, the UnitedHealthcare (UHC) portal, eviCore, and NextGen is highly beneficial. Prior exposure to sleep medicine, diagnostic testing, or DME is preferred but not required. We are looking for someone who communicates clearly, thinks critically, and thrives in a metrics-driven environment where precision and accountability matter.

This is not a task-based role. We are seeking a confident, assertive and experienced digital operator who can take initiative, drive strategy and deliver results.

Key Responsibilities

• Lead and execute social media strategy across Instagram, LinkedIn,
 and YouTube.

• Create premium branded content using Canva (advanced level required).

• Implement SEO strategies to improve organic visibility.

• Position the brand as a boutique specialist in the Sydney and broader market.

• Identify and support development of Professional Partner relationships (Accountants & Financial Planners).

• Assist with LinkedIn positioning and outreach strategies.

Required Skills & Experience

• Advanced Canva design capability.

• Strong CapCut video editing skills.

• Experience with automation tools (Submagic, Pyxa or equivalents).

• Understanding of SEO fundamentals and keyword positioning.

• Ability to integrate tools into efficient digital systems.

• Experience managing multi-platform social media strategy.

• Strategic thinking and commercial awareness.

• Ability to work independently and take ownership.

Bonus: Prior experience working with finance, mortgage, real estate or professional services brands.

Ideal Candidate

You are confident, assertive and proactive. You do not wait for instructions — you identify opportunities and execute. You understand digital systems, automation, brand positioning and professional engagement. You think strategically and deliver with precision.

How to Apply

Please provide the following:

1. Your CV.

2. Portfolio or social media accounts you have managed.

3. 2–3 Canva design samples.

4. 1 short-form video edited in CapCut.

Only experienced candidates who can demonstrate systems-thinking and strategic capability will be shortlisted.

title: SEO specialist
description:
Our website  photon.codes gets solid traction from developer communities, GitHub, HN, Reddit, and X — but we want to appear much higher (ideally first page) when people search for terms like "photon ai agents", "spectrum framework", "photon imessage", "ai agents messaging", and especially branded + intent searches around "photon".  



We're looking for a results-focused part-time SEO specialist to own quick wins and ongoing improvements so our site shows up prominently in Google for the right queries.



Key Responsibilities

- Audit & Quick Technical Wins — Run full technical SEO audits (using tools like Google Search Console, Screaming Frog, PageSpeed Insights, Ahrefs/Semrush if you have access). Fix crawl/indexing issues, Core Web Vitals, mobile usability, schema markup (especially for Article, SoftwareApplication, Organization), duplicate content, broken links, and HTTPS/mixed content problems.

- On-Page Optimization — Optimize title tags, meta descriptions, headings, alt text, internal linking, and keyword placement on high-priority pages (homepage, /spectrum, blog posts, /residency, etc.). Strengthen branding signals for "Photon" to help with branded search visibility.

- Keyword Research & Strategy — Identify high-intent, achievable keywords (long-tail + mid-competition) related to AI agents, messaging integrations, iMessage AI, open-source agent frameworks. Focus on terms where we can realistically rank in weeks/months rather than fighting Wikipedia/physics for generic "photon".

- Off-Page & Authority Building — Recommend/execute lightweight link-building tactics (guest posts, directory listings, HARO, outreach to AI/dev communities, Reddit/X amplification) without spammy tactics.

- Tracking & Reporting — Set up proper tracking in Google Search Console + Analytics (if not already). 

- Provide weekly/bi-weekly reports on rankings, impressions, clicks, traffic growth, and key fixes implemented. Goal: measurable organic traffic uplift.



Requirements

- Proven Experience — 2+ years hands-on SEO (agency, in-house, or freelance), with demonstrated results improving rankings/traffic for tech/startup/SaaS websites.

- Tool Proficiency — Comfortable with Google Search Console, Google Analytics 4, PageSpeed Insights, Screaming Frog, Ahrefs/Semrush/Ahrefs alternatives (free tiers ok), and basic schema tools.

- Technical SEO Skills — Strong understanding of Core Web Vitals, crawl budget, structured data, site speed optimization, mobile-first indexing.

- Results-Oriented & Independent — Self-starter who can prioritize high-impact tasks, work async, and communicate progress clearly (we use Slack/Notion).





We're reviewing applications on a rolling basis and aim to start within the next 1–2 weeks. Looking forward to hearing how you'd get photon.codes ranking higher fast!

Employment Type: Full-Time (40 hours/week)

Salary: $1,000/month

Schedule: PST Hours



About the Role

Woolbuddy is looking for an experienced Amazon FBA Virtual Assistant who can fully manage our Amazon account and PPC campaigns from day one.

This role is not for beginners or trainees. We need someone with proven, hands-on experience who can confidently take over account management, optimize listings, and run PPC without close supervision.

If you already know Amazon Seller Central inside and out, and can jump in immediately, we’d love to hear from you.



Key Responsibilities

Manage day-to-day operations in Amazon Seller Central

Create, optimize, and improve Amazon listings (SEO-focused)

Set up, manage, and optimize Amazon PPC campaigns

Monitor and manage inventory levels (FBA & FBM)

Coordinate shipping and fulfillment

Assist with product launches and promotions

Analyze sales performance, PPC data, and prepare reports

Stay updated with Amazon policies and best practices

Handle customer messages and basic account support

Complete tasks assigned by the supervisor



Requirements (IMPORTANT – Please Read)

Minimum 2 years of proven experience as an Amazon VA

Strong, hands-on experience managing a US Amazon Seller Central account

Proven experience running and optimizing Amazon PPC campaigns

Experience with inventory management (FBA & FBM)

Proven experience working with Helium 10, Sellerboard,etc.

Excellent communication and time management skills

Highly organized, detail-oriented, and dependable

Able to start immediately and work with minimal supervision

Applicants without direct Amazon Seller Central and PPC experience should NOT apply.

We are specifically looking for someone who can take over immediately, not someone who needs training.



What We Offer

Competitive pay based on experience and performance

Long-term, stable employment

Supportive and collaborative work environment

Opportunities for growth and skill development



Trial Period

There will be a paid 90-day trial period for both parties to ensure a good fit. If successful, this will transition into a long-term, full-time role.



How to Apply

Serious applicants only.

If you have solid experience managing Amazon Seller Central and PPC, please complete the application form below:





We’re excited to work with someone who’s ready to jump in and grow with Woolbuddy long-term.

title: Per-Edit Video & Photo Editor
description:
About Us



We are a fast-growing personal brand and education company in the finance and entrepreneurship space. We create:

• Long-form YouTube content

• Educational breakdown videos

• Lifestyle content

• Marketing ads

• Photo edits for social media & thumbnails

We are looking for a high-level creative editor who understands attention, retention, and storytelling — not just basic cuts.



 What We Need



You must be able to:

• Edit long-form YouTube videos (10–30 minutes)

• Edit short-form vertical content (30–90 seconds)

• Create engaging hooks in the first 3 seconds

• Add captions, motion graphics, b-roll, zoom-ins, sound effects

• Edit in different styles (clean, cinematic, high-energy, minimal, educational, lifestyle)

• Create scroll-stopping thumbnails

• Color grade properly

Bonus if you understand:

• Cinematic vlog edits



????Photo Editing Requirements

• Clean brand look (modern, minimal, high-contrast)

• Background edits / lighting correction

• High-quality exports



Pay Structure





If you are elite and fast, you will earn very well.

We care about quality + speed.



Who This Is For



You are:

• Detail-oriented

• Fast but accurate

• Creative (not robotic)

• Understand storytelling

• Able to take direction

This is not for beginners.

Growth Opportunity

If you want to grow with a serious brand, apply.

title: React/Supabase/Cloudflare Specialist Needed (Full Stack Developer)
description:
Looking for a seasoned developer that we can work 1 on 1 with to mange our app & production environments. Production and staging environment need to be migrated to Cloudflare sites + Supabase directly. Looking for a developer that can manage the infrastructure as well as the codebase. We want to preserve lovable as our sandbox & when ready to ship a feature, we hand it over to the dev for bug + error + security testing then test in staging, and ship to production when ready.



When bidding on this project please let us know if you're open to demoing a previous project that you've finished that uses a similar infrastructure. Looking for a developer that's actively working with this stack & knows the ins and outs. This will be an ongoing project for the right individual, not just a single migration. Need an AI first developer that can track bugs, auto map to linear and operate with 3 hats instead of 1. AI messages will be automatically disqualified- please personalize with a mention of todays date so we know you're not a bot and will check your message first. Thank you!

title: Executive Assistant
description:
Read This Before Applying

This is not a basic virtual assistant role.



If you are looking for simple task lists, calendar management, or repetitive admin work — this is not a fit.



This role exists to create leverage for a fast-moving CEO and COO at a growing U.S.-based marketing agency.



You will operate in a high-context, high-standards environment with frequent switching between hiring, writing, coordination, analytics, and execution.



If you thrive in ambiguity, think in systems, and use AI as a force multiplier — keep reading.



The Mission

Own the flow of information from raw input ? structured system ? finished output so leadership is no longer the bottleneck.

You will turn voice notes, Loom recordings, transcripts, and messy ideas into:

- Clean documents

- Structured hiring pipelines

- Organized dashboards

- Polished communication

- Reliable execution systems



If this role is done well, leadership feels:

- Fewer dropped balls

- Fewer repeated explanations

- Less mental clutter

- Cleaner systems

- Higher quality written output

If that does not happen, the role is not being executed correctly.



Core Areas of Ownership



1. Hiring Pipeline Execution

This is one of the highest-leverage areas.

- You will turn transcripts into:

-- Job descriptions

-- Scorecards

-- Interview questions

-- Must-have vs. nice-to-have lists

- Post jobs

- Track applicants

- Schedule interviews

- Send follow-ups

- Draft offer
s (approved before sending)

- Prepare offer letters from templates

- Coordinate references

- Manage onboarding logistics



You must be comfortable extracting structure fro
ssy conversations using AI tools.



2. “You Speak, They Build” Operations

The Founder communicates in:

- Loom videos

- Slack voice notes

- Call transcripts

- Bullet points



You turn them into:

- SOPs

- Checklists

- Notion docs

- Decision memos

- Organized execution plans

You are responsible for clarity.



3. COO Support & Internal Coordination

You will:

- Maintain executive priority trackers

- Prepare meeting agendas

- Capture notes and action items

- Follow up on commitments

- Build weekly summaries:

-- What moved

-- What’s stuck

-- What needs decision

You must follow up politely but persistently.



4. Travel & Logistics (Business + Personal)

You will own:

- Flights

- Hotels

- Itineraries

- Calendar adjustments

- Expense tracking

- Changes and cancellations

Mistakes here cost real money and time. Accuracy matters.



5. Data Organization & Reporting

You will:

- Clean messy spreadsheets

- Standardize naming conventions

- Structure data so it becomes usable

- Create charts for leadership review

- Maintain simple dashboards in Google Sheets

- Use AI tools to accelerate reporting

- Dashboards must support decisions — not decoration.



6. AI-Enabled Writing & Communication

You will draft:

- Internal announcements

- Client
s

- SOPs

- Hiring documents

- Onboarding materials

- Meeting follow-ups

- Templates



Writing must be:

- Clear

- Direct

- Professional

- No fluff

- Strong written English is mandatory.



Required Skills

You must demonstrate:

- Excellent written English

- Strong organizational ability

- High attention to detail

- Comfort working independently

- Ability to manage multiple workstreams



Proficiency with:

- Google Docs

- Google Sheets

- Calendars

- Slack

- Loom

- ChatGPT / Claude

You must be comfortable using AI daily to increase speed and clarity.



Work Expectations

- Full-time (35 hours/week)

- Minimum 6-hour overlap with US Pacific Time

- Responsive during working hours

- Written updates without prompting

- Issues escalated same day

- Missed deadlines without notice are unacceptable



This Role Is Not For You If:

- You need step-by-step instructions

- You wait to be told what to do

- You dislike writing

- You struggle with ambiguity

- You avoid follow-up

- You prefer repetitive task-only roles



Compensation

- $12,480–$16,640 USD per year

- Paid bi-monthly (1st and 15th)

- Full-time, long-term position

- Annual performance-based raise

- Stable role inside a growing company



What Good Looks Like After 60 Days

Leadership experiences:

- Cleaner systems

- Organized hiring pipelines

- Clear documentation

- Fewer dropped balls

- Less reactive scrambling

- Higher writing quality with less revision

If you are still waiting for instructions after 60 days, this role is not a fit.



Application Instructions (Required)

To be considered, you must include:

- A 3–5 minute Loom video introducing yourself

- Your internet speed (upload & download)

- Confirmation of US PT overlap hours

- A short explanation of how you use AI tools in your daily workflow

Applications missing these will not be reviewed.



What to Expect After Applying

If your application meets the requirements listed above, you will receive a skills assessment within 48 hours. The assessment is a practical exercise based on a real scenario you would encounter in this role. It is designed to take a strong candidate 60–90 minutes. We will evaluate your ability to gather information, organize it clearly, and communicate with a team — not whether you used AI to help. Candidates who score well on the assessment will be invited to a live interview. We respect your time and move quickly. 



Final Note

We are not hiring a helper. We are hiring a high-agency Executive Assistant who thinks like an operator and uses AI as leverage. If you want stability, growth, and real ownership — apply.

title: Senior Full-Stack Developer (DeFi and NFT Projects)
description:
About Energi

Energi (NRG) is a scalable and secure blockchain ecosystem, designed to power the next generation of Web3 applications, DeFi protocols, and NFT marketplaces. Built on a robust Proof of Stake (PoS) infrastructure, Energi combines Ethereum compatibility, on-chain governance, a self-funding treasury, and a Layer 2 masternode network to drive innovation in decentralized technology.

Our remote-first team spans the Americas, Europe, Africa, Asia, and Oceania, working together to push the boundaries of blockchain scalability and security. With a growing network of global contributors, we are committed to building a blockchain that is not only secure but also developer-friendly and highly scalable.

Energi is engineered to support millions of users, making it an ideal platform for high-performance dApps, NFT marketplaces, and decentralized finance solutions. Our ecosystem is designed for fast, cost-effective transactions with a focus on long-term sustainability.

By fostering collaboration, innovation, and a forward-thinking culture, Energi is redefining the Web3 landscape. Explore our vision and mission at 
.





WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU:

-Work flexible hours from anywhere as part of a globally distributed team driven by innovation and shared values.

-Directly shape the future of blockchain technology in NFT development.

-Enhance your skills and creativity with cutting-edge blockchain, smart contract, and Web3 technologies.

-Be part of an advanced blockchain ecosystem and contribute to building next-gen NFT platforms.

-Competitive pay structure in a 50/50 split of ETH and NRG tokens.



Front-End Role

JOB OVERVIEW:

We seek a Blockchain Full-Stack Engineer specializing in NFT platforms to drive the front-end development of our decentralized applications. You’ll create immersive Web3 experiences while integrating blockchain-based features like Metamask and smart contracts.



JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:

-Work closely with UX designers to create seamless NFT marketplaces and dApps.

-Develop interactive front-end features integrating Web3.js and smart contracts.

-Optimize UI performance and ensure mobile responsiveness.

-Maintain existing applications and introduce new blockchain features.



ESSENTIAL REQUIREMENTS:

-3+ years of experience in front-end development.

-Proficient in React, Gatsby, and Web3 frameworks.

-Experience integrating blockchain wallets like Metamask.

-Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.

-Fluent English communicator with a passion for blockchain.



NICE TO HAVE:

-Experience with Web3, Infura, and The Graph.

-Familiarity with NFT metadata standards and ERC-721/ERC-1155.

-SEO optimization skills.



Back-End Role

JOB OVERVIEW:

We’re looking for a Blockchain Full-Stack Engineer to build the backend for NFT applications. You’ll be responsible for designing, maintaining, and optimizing APIs that connect blockchain smart contracts with scalable Web3 applications.



JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:

-Develop secure APIs that interact with NFT smart contracts.

-Optimize backend infrastructure for high-traffic NFT transactions.

-Implement blockchain indexing solutions for NFT metadata retrieval.

-Write unit tests to ensure security and efficiency.



ESSENTIAL REQUIREMENTS:

-3+ years of back-end development experience.

-Proficiency in Golang, NodeJS, and GraphQL.

-Experience with blockchain data structures and decentralized storage.

-Passionate about blockchain innovation and fluent in English.



NICE TO HAVE:

-Knowledge of smart contract security best practices.

-Prior experience with NFT minting platforms.

-Remote work experience.



This role is not open to 3rd party organizations or agencies. Any candidates sent will be considered free of any charges



Energi is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics.

title: Senior AWS Engineer – AWS Cost Optimization & Kubernetes
description:
Job Description:

About the Role

We're a blockchain/DeFi company running production infrastructure that's bleeding money unnecessarily. Our AWS bill is sitting at $4,500/month – and we know it shouldn't be anywhere near that. We need someone who can come in, audit the whole setup, and actually fix it. Not just give us a report that sits in a folder.



We've already been through a few candidates who talked a big game but couldn't execute. We're done with that. If you're the type who needs handholding or can't work independently, this isn't for you.





What You'll Actually Do

- Audit our entire AWS infrastructure and identify exactly where we're wasting money (we expect significant savings)

- Optimize our Kubernetes clusters – right-size nodes, fix resource requests/limits, implement autoscaling that actually works

- Implement cost controls: Reserved Instances, Savings Plans, spot instances where appropriate, and cleanup of orphaned resources

- Set up monitoring and alerts so costs don't creep back up without us knowing

- Document everything you do so the team can maintain it





Hard Requirements (Non-Negotiable)

- 3+ years hands-on Kubernetes experience in production environments – EKS specifically preferred

- Deep AWS knowledge: EC2, EKS, RDS, S3, CloudWatch, Cost Explorer, Trusted Advisor

- Proven track record of actually reducing AWS costs (be ready to share numbers/percentages)

- Strong scripting skills (Python, Bash) for automation

- Infrastructure as Code: Terraform or CloudFormation (Terraform preferred)

- Self-starter who can take ownership and execute without constant oversight





!!!!CRITICAL: This Role Requires Surgical Precision

This is production infrastructure running live systems. Think of this like surgery – one wrong move can take everything down.

- NO cowboy moves. You don't delete, modify, or remove anything without a clear plan first.

- Every change must be planned out, documented, and confirmed with the CEO before execution.

- Extreme attention to detail. You double-check and triple-check before touching anything.

- If you're not 100% sure what something does, you ask first. You don't assume.

- Methodical execution only. We value careful and correct over fast and reckless.





Strong Plus

- Experience with blockchain/Web3 infrastructure

- Karpenter, Cluster Autoscaler, or KEDA experience

-  AWS certifications (Solutions Architect, DevOps Engineer)

- Experience with FinOps tools (Kubecost, CloudHealth, 
)





What We Need In Your Application

Don't send a generic application. We will ignore it. Include:

- Specific examples of AWS cost optimization you've done – what was the setup, what did you change, what % did you save?

- Your Kubernetes experience – cluster sizes you've managed, scaling strategies you've implemented

- Your availability and timezone (we need someone who can overlap with US business hours for some calls)





Compensation & Structure

- $20-25/hour based on experience and proven results

- 20 hours/week to start – potential for more hours for the right person

- Fully remote

- Initial project: Comprehensive audit + implementation plan with clear cost reduction targets





If you're someone who can actually deliver results and not just talk about them – we want to hear from you. Show us what you've done.

title: Product Design Engineer – Advanced 3D Printing (Remote)
description:
Product Design Engineer – 3D Printing (Bambu Lab Focus)



We are seeking an advanced Product Design Engineer specializing in functional 3D print design for Bambu Lab printers. This role involves creating production-ready parts, mechanical components, and product designs optimized for strength, efficiency, and real-world use.



This is NOT a decorative modeling role. We are looking for experienced professionals who understand tolerances, mechanical fit, print optimization, and manufacturing efficiency.





---



Responsibilities



• Design functional 3D printable parts and products

• Create mechanical assemblies and interlocking components

• Optimize designs for Bambu Lab printers and high-speed printing

• Minimize supports, reduce print time, and improve strength

• Apply proper tolerances for press-fit, snap-fit, and moving parts

• Prepare clean, production-ready STL and STEP files

• Revise designs based on testing and performance feedback

• Ensure files are ready for repeatable, reliable production





---



Required Skills & Experience



• Advanced experience with Fusion 360, SolidWorks, or similar CAD software

• Strong understanding of tolerances, fit, and mechanical function

• Experience designing functional parts (NOT decorative models)

• Knowledge of print orientation, strength optimization, and material behavior

• Ability to reduce supports and improve print efficiency

• Experience preparing files for production-level printing

• Ability to clearly explain design decisions





---



Preferred Experience



• Designing enclosures, mounts, brackets, or mechanical systems

• Snap-fit and press-fit design experience

• Experience optimizing parts for high-speed printers

• Knowledge of PLA, PETG, ABS, ASA, TPU, and material strengths

• Experience designing parts for electronics or consumer products





---



Compensation



Probationary Period (First 90 Days): $5–$7/hour

Post-Review Performance Pay: $8–$20/hour based on skill, efficiency, and production quality



Probation may end early for exceptional performance.



Long-term, consistent work is available for high performers.





---



REQUIRED SKILLS TEST (Creativity + Engineering)



To be considered, complete the following design challenge:



Design a functional 3D printed product optimized for Bambu Lab printing.



You may choose ANY useful product (examples: electronics enclosure, cable organizer, mounting system, tool holder, modular storage system, snap-fit case, adjustable stand, etc.).



We want to see how you think, engineer, and improve real-world usability.





---



Design Requirements



• Must serve a real-world functional purpose

• Must print WITHOUT supports

• Must be optimized for strength and efficiency

• Must include at least one functional feature:



snap-fit



press-fit



interlocking parts



moving component



modular connection

• Must be optimized for PLA or PETG

• Must be designed for fast, reliable printing







---



Alternative Submission Option



You may submit a previous design instead of creating a new one if it meets all requirements above.



The work must be your original design.





---



AI & Originality Disclosure



AI tools may be used to assist your workflow.



If AI was used, you must clearly explain:



• which tools were used

• what part of the design process they assisted with

• what parts were created entirely by you



Failure to disclose AI usage or submitting non-original work will disqualify the application.





---



Submit



• STL file

• STEP file

• Screenshot of CAD model

• Estimated print time

• Recommended material

• Brief explanation of:

– tolerances used

– print orientation choice

– how supports were eliminated

– how strength was optimized

– why your design is useful





---



Applications without the completed test or qualifying portfolio submission will not be reviewed.



We are looking for professionals who can create smart, efficient, real-world designs — not just models.

title: Crypto BD Partner - $10,000+ Potential in 90 Days

Note: A "successful partnership" is defined by the project signing the LP Bonds integration agreement and going live on our marketplace.

/
 relationships with project founders or marketing heads

 handle

- whether you have a separate typing keyboard or you use your laptop keyboard?- whether your keyboard as a number pad (which is its own dedicated numbers on the right of the keyboard)

- whether you're looking for a full time job (8 hours a day) or part time job (4 hours a day)

title: Creative Strategist – Paid Social (D2C) | Full-Time Remote
description:
About ARDANT



Jewelry you never take off. 130,000+ customers across the US, UK, Australia, and Canada in under 1.5 years. Our team has scaled brands from launch to eight figures and beyond. See our work at 
.



The Role



We built this brand on the back of ad creative that works. This role owns that function.



You'll lead a creative pod of a video editor and graphic designer, responsible for the volume, quality, and speed of everything that goes out. You'll write the briefs, set the direction, analyze what's performing, and keep raising the bar on what winning looks like.



If you've been producing results at another brand but feel like your work isn't moving fast enough or you're ready for more ownership, this is worth your attention.



---



What You'll Own



1. Ad brief production. Write 20+ briefs per week across video and static formats. Clear, strategic, and executable.

2. Customer research. Develop and refine ad avatars based on real customer insight. Know who you're targeting before you brief a single frame.

3. Creative direction. Direct your pod to execute at a high standard. You know what good looks like and communicate it clearly.

4. Performance analysis. Review ad performance weekly. Understand what's working, what isn't, and develop sharper hypotheses each time.

5. Iteration. Produce effective variations of winning ads. Keep the pipeline moving.

6. Feedback Loop. Document learnings and feed them back into the next round of briefs.



---



What We're Looking For



Must-haves:

- 5+ years in marketing, currently or most recently working as a Creative Strategist producing winning ads for D2C brands.

- A strong portfolio of ad creative, video and static, with results to back it up.

- Proven experience directing video editors and graphic designers.

- Direct response copywriting skills. Hooks, headlines, and scripts that drive action.

- Deep understanding of Meta and Instagram ad formats and what performs.

- Research-driven approach to customer personas and audience targeting.

- Ability to diagnose underperforming ads and come back with stronger ideas.

- Strong communicator who can brief and collaborate at pace.



Bonus points, strong priority:

- Winning ads in North American, UK, or Australian markets for women's lifestyle or beauty brands.

- Problem-solution creative angles in fashion, beauty, or lifestyle categories.

- Experience inside a performance or growth marketing team.



---



What Success Looks Like



This role is KPI-driven. You'll be measured on three things:

- **Volume.** Hitting brief targets consistently each week.

- **Quality.** Winning ad hit rate across the pod's output.

- **Speed.** Time from brief to live creative.



---



Why Join ARDANT



We move fast. Briefs go live within days and you'll see the direct impact of your work in real time on a global audience.



You'll work with senior leaders who have taken brands from zero to eight figures and beyond. We're building something with serious long-term ambition and the creative function is central to how we get there. The team is sharp, the feedback is honest, and the standard is high because everyone holds themselves to it.



- Competitive salary with performance bonuses.

- Real ownership of a function that directly drives brand growth.

- Strong performers take on more as the brand scales.

- Fully remote. Flexible hours.



---



How to Apply



Send your CV and a portfolio of ad creatives you've produced for D2C brands. Applications without a portfolio will not be considered.



We're hiring fast. Strong applicants hear from us first.

title: Podcast + YouTube Growth Operator (VA Role)
description:
This is not a task role. This is a growth seat.



I run a performance-driven personal brand serving speakers, performers, coaches, and creators worldwide. 



My work helps experts turn audiences into paying clients and get booked on more stages. 

Content is the engine. Distribution is the lever. Growth is the mandate.



I’m hiring someone to take ownership of my podcast and YouTube ecosystem and scale it.



If you are average, slow, reactive, or need constant direction, this will not work.

If you are strategic, fast, and obsessed with performance metrics, keep reading.



WHAT THIS ROLE ACTUALLY IS



You are responsible for turning raw recordings into discoverable, clickable, bingeable content that grows audience, authority, and leads.



You are not here to “help.”

You are here to drive growth.



You will own the systems, optimization, and publishing pipeline across:



• Podcast platforms (hosted on Libsyn)

• YouTube long-form

• YouTube Shorts

• Repurposed vertical clips



CORE RESPONSIBILITIES

Content Operations



• Manage full content pipeline from raw file to published asset

• Maintain publishing calendar

• Organize episodes, clips, assets, titles, and concepts

• Ensure consistency with brand voice and positioning



Growth Optimization



• Write high-CTR titles

• Design or direct thumbnails

• Research competitors and trends

• Identify viral hooks inside long content

• Optimize retention through editing direction



Distribution Systems



• Upload and optimize podcast episodes inside Libsyn and distribution platforms

• Upload and optimize YouTube videos

• Write descriptions, chapters, tags, metadata

• Build playlists and viewer journeys

• Repurpose long-form into shorts and clips



Analytics + Strategy



• Track CTR, retention, watch time, subscribers, downloads, and conversions

• Produce weekly performance reports

• Identify what is working, what is failing, and why

• Recommend clear next moves



WHO THIS IS FOR



You should apply if you:



• Have grown a YouTube or podcast channel before

• Think in metrics, not opinions

• Notice patterns most people miss

• Care about titles as much as content

• Move fast without sacrificing accuracy

• Communicate clearly and directly

• Take ownership instead of waiting for direction



Bonus if you:

• Understand speakers, creators, or education brands

• Have Libsyn or podcast platform experience

• Have Kajabi experience

• Edit video or direct editors

• Study algorithms for fun



STANDARDS



If hired, you will be expected to:



• Meet deadlines every time

• Communicate daily

• Bring solutions, not problems

• Maintain brand consistency

• Operate independently

• Treat the channel like it is your own



This is a performance role. Results matter.



TOOLS (NOT REQUIRED BUT HELPFUL)



YouTube Studio

Libsyn

Podcast directories (Apple, Spotify, etc.)

Google Drive / Sheets

Canva

Descript / CapCut or equivalent

Kajabi



If you learn fast, tools are irrelevant. Adaptability matters more than software knowledge.



REQUIRED SKILL TEST (MANDATORY)



To be considered, complete this quick task.



Scenario



You are given a 12-minute podcast interview episode featuring a speaker teaching how to turn live audiences into paying clients.



The goal of the content is to:



• Grow my personal brand authority

• Increase inbound speaking opportunities

• Attract qualified leads for paid programs

• Grow subscribers who are speakers, coaches, creators, and experts



Submit the Following



1. Title Strategy

Write 3 YouTube titles designed to attract high-level speakers, coaches, or experts.



2. Clip Strategy

Identify 3 short-form clips you would extract and explain:



the hook



the audience psychology it triggers



why it would perform algorithmically



3. Packaging Plan

Outline exactly how you would publish the episode:



description structure



tags / keywords



chapters



thumbnail concept



CTA placement strategy



4. Growth Intelligence

Name the first 2 metrics you would track and explain:



what each metric signals



what decision it would influence



Submission Format



Provide your answers as a Google Doc or PDF link.



Applications that skip this task will not be reviewed.



HOW TO APPLY



 subject line:



Growth Operator Application – [Your Name]



Include:



Short intro



Links to channels you’ve worked on



Best performing video or episode you helped grow



Your completed skill test



Your rate



Incomplete applications will not be reviewed.



FINAL NOTE



This role can become long-term and high leverage for the right person. If you want a position where your decisions directly affect growth, authority, and reach, this is that role.



If you want a checklist job, this is not.

Turn AI visuals into:



Scroll-stopping video ads



Clean, realistic brand content

More consistent work



Expanded role



AI Storytelling (Secondary Brand)

Focus on realism, mood, and narrative-driven visuals



What We’re Looking For

You dislike iteration and feedback



Time Commitment

Opportunity to grow into:



More hours



Video ads



Long-term role



Pay

Pay increases quickly for consistent, high-quality work.

AI tools you’ve used

title: AI Cinematic Reels Storyteller
description:
Create AI-Powered Reels That Stop the Scroll and Move Hearts



Love of God is a fast-growing Christian brand creating cinematic, story-driven Instagram Reels designed to inspire, convict, and spread—not just exist online.



Our content blends biblical truth, sermon 
nts, and AI-generated cinematic visuals to create Reels people save, share, and send to friends.



We are not looking for a traditional editor.



We are looking for someone who can create cinematic AI B-roll and AI video storytelling that visually brings Scripture, themes, and emotion to life.



This is not basic caption editing.

This is AI-powered cinematic storytelling in short form.



???? What You’ll Do



Edit 3 Instagram Reels per week (30–60 seconds), scaling to 5/week



Create AI-generated B-roll and AI video scenes to support sermon clips and biblical themes



Turn spoken-word sermons into cinematic visual stories using AI footage



Use AI visuals to depict:



Biblical symbolism



Spiritual warfare



Light vs darkness



Redemption, repentance, hope, conviction



Add sound design, music, captions, pacing, and visual rhythm that elevate the message



Color grade for warmth, depth, reverence (no harsh filters, no gimmicks)



Edit intentionally for retention, emotional build, and shareability



Receive feedback and iterate quickly—we care deeply about excellence



???? This Role Is AI-First (Read Carefully)



You are a strong fit if:



You actively use AI tools to generate cinematic B-roll or AI video



You can turn abstract ideas (Scripture, faith, conviction) into visual stories



You understand storytelling, pacing, emotional restraint, and buildup



You’ve created AI-generated video content (portfolio required)

You care about faith-based content that actually impacts people—not fluff



You should be comfortable with tools like:



AI video generation platforms (Runway, Pika, Gen-3, Sora-style workflows, etc.)



AI image ? motion workflows



Prompting for cinematic tone, lighting, symbolism, and emotion



Editing Software:



Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, or DaVinci Resolve



DaVinci Resolve is a plus



???? Creative Direction References



Our visual tone is inspired by:



Cinematic biblical storytelling



Film-quality lighting and pacing



Premium, reverent aesthetics (not cheesy Christian content)



If your style leans cheap, templated, or TikTok-trendy, this is not the role.



???? Pay & Growth



$15-$25 USD per Reel to start



3 Reels/week (opportunity to scale to 5)



Performance bonuses for Reels that hit major view milestones



Long-term growth, higher rates, and increased creative responsibility



Work with a brand that is serious about mission, quality, and excellence



? Time Commitment



~10–15 hours per week for 3 high-quality Reels



Includes revisions and feedback loops



???? How to Apply (Read Carefully – Incomplete Applications Ignored)

Links to 2–3 AI-generated video Reels or AI cinematic projects



A short message explaining:



Your experience creating AI B-roll / AI video storytelling



Why you enjoy creating meaningful, faith-based content



Your:



AI tools you use



Editing software



Weekly availability



Confirmation you can deliver 3–5 Reels/week at $15 each



Final Word



We are not looking for speed-only editors.

We are not looking for basic clip-cutters.



We are looking for taste, storytelling instinct, and AI-powered creativity.



If that excites you—we want to talk.

title: Booking & Outreach Operator (VA Role)
description:
This is not an admin role. This is a revenue role.



I’m a speaker, performer, and educator who helps experts become magnetic on stage and turn audiences into paying clients. My work spans keynotes, emceeing, workshops, podcast interviews, and live events.



I’m hiring someone to own booking outreach and opportunity generation so I can spend more time on stages and less time chasing them.



If you wait to be told what to do, this role will overwhelm you.

If you enjoy tracking opportunities, starting conversations, and turning outreach into booked stages, keep reading.



WHAT THIS ROLE ACTUALLY IS



You are responsible for finding, qualifying, pitching, and tracking speaking and appearance opportunities.



You are not just sending
s.

You are building a pipeline of booked stages.



Your success will be measured by:



• Qualified opportunities generated

• Conversations started

• Bookings secured

• Revenue influenced



CORE RESPONSIBILITIES

Opportunity Sourcing



• Research events, conferences, podcasts, stages, and hosts

• Identify decision makers and contact info

• Build and maintain outreach databases

• Prioritize high-value opportunities



Outreach Execution



• Send personalized pitches

• Follow up consistently

• Track responses and conversations

• Adjust messaging based on results



Booking Pipeline Management



• Maintain CRM or tracking sheet

• Track stage status from prospect ? booked ? completed

• Flag hot leads and urgent replies

• Prepare summaries before calls or negotiations



Positioning Intelligence



• Identify which stages are most aligned with brand growth

• Spot partnership or collaboration opportunities

• Recommend outreach angles

• Track which messaging converts best



WHO THIS IS FOR



You should apply if you:



• Have booked guests, speakers, or clients before

• Are comfortable initiating conversations with strangers

• Can write concise, persuasive outreach messages

• Think in pipelines and conversion rates

• Are organized and detail oriented

• Move fast and communicate clearly

• Follow up without being reminded



Bonus if you:

• Have worked in PR, booking, or partnerships

• Understand speaker or creator industries

• Have CRM or lead tracking experience

• Enjoy negotiation or deal flow



STANDARDS



If hired, you will be expected to:



• Send outreach daily

• Track every conversation

• Follow up consistently

• Maintain organized records

• Bring opportunity ideas weekly

• Operate independently



This role directly impacts revenue and visibility. Precision matters.



TOOLS (NOT REQUIRED BUT HELPFUL)



Google Sheets or CRM tools

 platforms

LinkedIn

Research tools

Calendar scheduling systems



Tools can be learned. Initiative cannot.



REQUIRED SKILL TEST (MANDATORY)



To be considered, complete this task.



Scenario



You are tasked with booking me for speaking engagements and podcast interviews that attract high-level speakers, coaches, and creators.



Submit the Following



1. Opportunity Targeting

List 5 specific stages, podcasts, or events you would pitch first and explain why.



2. Outreach Message

Write one personalized pitch
 you would send to a host or event organizer.



3. Follow-Up Strategy

Outline your follow-up timeline and messaging approach.



4. Prioritization Logic

Explain how you d
 which opportunities are worth pursuing versus ignoring.



Submission Format



Provide answers as a Google Doc or PDF link.



Applications without this task will not be reviewed.



HOW TO APPLY



 subject line:



Booking Operator Application – [Your Name]



Include:



Short intro



Relevant experience



Example outreach message you’ve written before



Completed skill test



Your rate



Incomplete applications will not be reviewed.



FINAL NOTE



This role can become long-term and high leverage for the right person. If you want a position where your work directly creates opportunities, visibility, and bookings, this is that role.



If you want a passive assistant position, this is not.

title: Client Care Coordinator
description:
Looking for long-term employment?  That's exactly what we're offering...



We're an entrepreneurial bankruptcy firm that’s experiencing continued aggressive growth and we're in need of assistance with file management, client portal management, and engaging in regular
 communication.



You'll hit the ground running quickly and your responsibilities will include:

- Client portal management: you will be responsible for monitoring client's progress in their portals on a daily basis, and this will involve checking task completion, file management, and communicating with clients in the portal.  You will manage between 60 to 100 client portals at any given time.

- File management: you will be responsible for ensuring that all client documents are saved in the correct folders with the correct names.  This will require checking multiple locations daily for new documents and promptly ensuring they're saved in the correct location.

-
 communication: you will provide regular, weekly updates to clients recapping the progress they've made during the week and highlighting next steps.  You will be responsible for
ing clients who have stopped progressing or stopped paying to try to recapture their attention and get them back on track.  You must be prepared to stay completely up to date on all
s and respond to all inbound
s you receive daily

Status tracking: you will track the status of all assigned clients as they progress through various phases while they're assigned to you.  This requires constant attention and must be done carefully.



The ideal candidate will be resourceful, take initiative, be very detail oriented and highly organized.  You should have a customer service background and be ready to join an engaged team.



You must also be able to adapt quickly to change and correctly reassess priorities as new tasks are added.  



Our team is entirely virtual and we regularly chat with each other throughout the day.  We're very supportive and we all love to learn and share what we know.  If you're excited to be part of a team that loves to work hard and succeed together, there will be room for training and development as we continue growing.

title: Instagram DM Sales Closer (Christian Apparel Brand)
description:
Love of God is a rapidly growing Christian clothing brand built on impact, excellence, and authenticity. We’re not just selling apparel — we’re building a movement rooted in faith, depth, and real connection.



We’re looking for a high-performing DM Sales Closer who knows how to build genuine relationships through Instagram and
 messaging — and turn conversations into customers.



This is not entry-level support.



This is relationship-driven sales.



The Role



You will manage conversations through Instagram and
 
 using Meta Business Suite.



Your mission:



• Build trust

• Create real connection

• Handle objections confidently

• Guide conversations toward a natural close



This starts as a part-time position (10–20 hours per week) with room to grow as revenue scales.



What You’ll Be Responsible For



• Responding quickly and professionally to inbound DMs

• Starting conversations with warm followers when appropriate

• Building genuine rapport (no robotic copy-paste responses)

• Answering product questions clearly and confidently

• Handling objections like “It’s too expensive” or “I’ll think about it”

• Following up with warm leads who haven’t purchased

• Tracking conversations and sales generated

• Increasing overall DM conversion rates



Requirements



You must have:



• Excellent written English (natural, conversational tone)

• Proven sales experience (chat or call closing preferred)

• Customer support experience

• Strong emotional intelligence

• Confidence in persuasion without being aggressive

• Reliable internet connection

• Availability that overlaps with U.S. daytime hours



Bonus points if you:



• Have worked with eCommerce brands

• Understand Instagram culture and buyer psychology

• Have experience inside Meta Business Suite

• Have worked in commission-based roles



Compensation



This is a performance-based role.



• Base Pay: $4–$5 per hour (based on experience)

• Commission: 8–10% of sales generated from your tracked conversations



Hours will begin at 10–20 per week and expand as traffic and sales grow.



High performers will earn increased commission and expanded responsibility.



Growth Path



Top performers can grow into:



• Lead DM Closer

• Sales Team Manager

• Community Growth Lead



We reward performance — not tenure.



How to Apply



Please answer the following:



What sales experience do you have?



Have you ever closed a sale through chat? Describe your process.



How would you respond to:

• “I love it, but it’s too expensive.”

• “I’ll think about it.”

title: Doc Drawer (US Mortgage Company | Full-Time | Night Shift | Remote)
description:
Work Setup: 100% Remote (Work From Home)

Schedule: Monday to Friday | Night Shift (U.S. Pacific Time)

Employment Type: Full-Time | Long-Term Position



About the Role



We are a U.S.-based mortgage company looking for a Doc Drawer to join our growing operations team.



Your main responsibility is to prepare and generate accurate loan documents before closing. This is a critical position — errors in documentation can delay loan closings, so we are looking for someone who is highly detail-oriented and reliable.



If you are organized, focused, and serious about building a long-term career in the U.S. mortgage industry, this role is for you.



Fresh graduates are welcome to apply. Applicants with 1–2 years of U.S. mortgage experience are strongly preferred.



Training will be provided to the right candidate.



Key Responsibilities:

> Prepare and generate initial and closing loan documents

> Review loan approvals prior to document generation

> Verify borrower information, loan terms, fees, and rates

> Ensure documents meet compliance and investor guidelines

> Coordinate with processors, underwriters, and closing team

> Maintain internal tracking and documentation accuracy

> Ensure loan packages are complete before release



Qualifications

> Extremely detail-oriented (this is non-negotiable)

> Strong organizational and time management skills

> Good written English communication

> Basic to intermediate skills in Google Workspace or Microsoft Office

> Stable internet connection and quiet home workspace

> Willing to work night shift (PST schedule)

> Able to work independently without constant supervision



Preferred but Not Required

> Experience in U.S. mortgage (doc drawing, processing, closing, underwriting)

> Familiarity with mortgage disclosures and closing documents

> Experience working in a remote setup



What We Offer

> Competitive monthly salary (based on experience)

> Stable, long-term position

> Monday–Friday work only (Weekends off)

> Growth opportunity in the U.S. mortgage industry

> Professional and supportive work environment



>> IMPORTANT APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS (READ CAREFULLY)



To be considered:

1. Send your application through OnlineJobs.ph

2. Include a DIRECT LINK to your resume (Google Drive / OneDrive / Dropbox)

3. Make sure the link is set to “Anyone with the link can view”

4. Include the word “DOCREADY” at the top of your application message



Applications without a resume link

Applications without the keyword “DOCREADY”

Resume links that require permission



? Will be automatically rejected.



We only review applicants who follow instructions. Attention to detail starts with your application.

- Integrate APIs including Stripe, Google APIs, CRMs, webhooks, and internal services

- Develop webhook systems, data pipelines, and workflow logic

- Assist in deploying AI agents (voice + chat systems)

- Troubleshoot authentication, integration errors, and automation failures

- Document automation systems clearly for handoff and scaling

- Improve system stability, performance, and reliability

- Support scaling internal AI products and tools

- Contribute to basic UI/UX for internal SaaS tools when needed





Required Skills

You should have:

- Strong experience with n8n / Zapier / Make

- Confidence working with APIs, webhooks, and authentication flows

- Ability to debug integration issues independently

- Strong logical thinking and structured problem solving

- Clear async communication and good documentation habits

- 1–2 years of AI automation experience

- Experience with VAPI or similar voice AI tools





Preferred Skills

Nice to have (but not required):

- Master agent creation and multi-agent workflows

- Web scraping experience

- Experience deploying automation systems in production environments

- Familiarity with uptime monitoring, retries, and workflow resilience





Compensation (PECP Model)

Starting Base Rate: $4.75–$6.00/hour (based on experience + work completion)

Payout Schedule: Bi-weekly

Performance Bonuses Based On:

- Successful deployment of automation projects

- System reliability and uptime

- Speed of implementation

- Reduction of manual work hours

- Contributions to product scalability





Growth Track

This role has a clear long-term path:

Mid-Level ? Senior AI Engineer ? AI Team Lead ? Director of AI Development

Top performers may be eligible for:

- Compensation increases

- Revenue-share discussions

- Leadership responsibilities





Ideal For

This role is ideal for engineers who:

- Enjoy building real AI systems (not just prototypes)

- Like solving messy workflow problems

- Want long-term growth in AI infrastructure and automation

- Prefer execution and ownership over constant meetings





How to Apply

Send the following:

- Resume

- A short description of automation systems you’ve built

- Tools you’re strongest in

- One example of an API integration you’ve implemented

etings and training sessions

title: Financial Analyst with Salesforce Exp
description:
Overview:



We are seeking a highly driven and strategic Financial Analyst to serve as a key partner to the executive leadership team. This role is ideal for a finance professional who combines strong technical expertise with business acumen and thrives in a fast-paced, data-driven environment. The successful candidate will transform complex financial data into meaningful insights, enabling informed decision-making that supports organizational growth, operational excellence, and long-term profitability.



Job Title: Financial Analyst

Location: Fully Remote

Job Type: Full-Time



Key Responsibilities



Executive Financial Partnership

Act as a trusted financial advisor to the CEO by delivering high-impact analysis, forecasts, and strategic recommendations.

Translate financial data into executive-ready insights that drive performance, scalability, and sustainable growth.

Develop financial models to support investment decisions, operational initiatives, and long-term planning.



Strategic Analysis & Business Intelligence



Identify emerging trends, risks, and opportunities through advanced financial and operational analysis.

Research market dynamics, competitor positioning, and industry benchmarks to strengthen strategic direction.

Establish and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to evaluate business health and guide leadership decisions.



Syndication Leadership



Oversee syndication processes, ensuring seamless coordination between lenders, investors, and internal stakeholders.

Manage the preparation of documentation, payment processing, and distribution with precision and timeliness.

Safeguard compliance with syndication agreements and applicable regulatory standards.



Commission Oversight



Administer commission structures with accuracy and transparency.

Ensure timely calculations and disbursements while continuously improving process efficiency and controls.

Financial Accounting & Reporting Excellence

Lead Financial Accounting and Reporting activities, ensuring accuracy, integrity, and adherence to best practices.

Prepare executive-level financial reports, dashboards, and presentations that clearly communicate performance, forecasts, and strategic implications.

Strengthen reporting frameworks to enhance visibility and support data-driven leadership.



Operational Efficiency & Systems



Utilize advanced Excel capabilities to build dynamic financial models and automate reporting workflows.

Leverage QuickBooks expertise to maintain reliable financial data and support the full cycle of accounting.

Perform thorough bank reconciliations and implement controls that promote quality and financial accuracy.

Continuously identify opportunities to optimize financial processes and elevate reporting standards.



Required Skills & Qualifications



Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related discipline.

Minimum of 3+ years of progressive experience in financial analysis, accounting, or financial management.

Demonstrated expertise in the full cycle of accounting, including reconciliations, reporting, and close processes.

Strong foundation in Financial Accounting and Reporting within a growth-oriented organization.

QuickBooks Certification or advanced working knowledge required.

Proven commitment to quality, accuracy, and strong internal controls.

Exceptional communication skills with the ability to influence and engage executive stakeholders.

Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel, including complex formulas, PivotTables, and financial modeling.

High level of analytical rigor with the ability to synthesize complex data into clear strategic insights.

Strong organizational skills with the capacity to manage multiple priorities independently.



Preferred Leadership Traits



Executive presence with a proactive, solutions-oriented mindset.

Strategic thinker capable of balancing big-picture vision with meticulous execution.

High degree of professionalism, discretion, and integrity when handling confidential financial information.

Adaptable, resilient, and comfortable operating in a dynamic, high-growth environment.

Collaborative partner who builds strong cross-functional relationships.

title: Remote Nurse (RN/LVN) — Charting & Clinical Documentation (Virtual Assistant)
description:
We’re hiring a licensed nurse with aesthetic/dermatology or medspa experience to support our team by completing charting and clinical documentation for patient visits. This is a remote role focused on accurate notes, consistent templates, and HIPAA-compliant documentation.

Responsibilities

* Complete chart notes in our EMR for aesthetic visits (consults + follow-ups)

* Document: HPI, treatment history, allergies/meds, contraindications, consent status, and post-care instructions

* Support procedure documentation (ex: tox/filler, lasers, microneedling, body treatments, skin plans—based on provider protocols)

* Assist with clinical admin as needed: lab uploads (if applicable), follow-up tasks, patient messaging, photo documentation labeling (if used)

* Maintain HIPAA compliance, accuracy, and fast turnaround

Requirements

* Active RN or LVN/LPN license

* Aesthetic / dermatology / plastic surgery / medspa experience (required)

* Strong EMR + medical documentation skills

* Excellent written English, detail-oriented, consistent formatting

* Reliable internet + private workspace

Bonus

* Experience documenting injectables + laser treatments

* Familiar with pre/post-care protocols and contraindications

* Experience with telehealth workflows

Hours/Pay

* Part-time to start with ability to grow

* Compensation based on experience

To apply?Send: license type/state, relevant aesthetic experience, EMR(s) used, availability, and a brief note about your charting workflow.

title: Video Editor & Motion Designer
description:
Feed (
) is a creative video studio that turns founder 
nts, customer stories, and brand ideas into scroll-stopping, story-driven videos that feel human and convert. We specialize in crafting compelling short-form storytelling content.



Note: A portfolio is required for your application to be considered.



We’re looking for a Video Editor to help shape high-quality, story-driven short-form content from raw footage to final delivery. You’ll work closely with the Founder/Creative Strategist to bring ideas to life in a way that feels intentional, human, and visually polished. This role is for an editor who thinks in stories, not just timelines. Here are the types of videos you’ll be expected to make:

- 

- 
/shorts/Cke80ercpkA

- 
/shorts/AuV7_-v6JNg



This position is a full-time contract role for 3 months. As trust and 
ntum builds, there’s a clear path to transitioning into a full-time, long-term role with increased ownership and responsibility.



What You’ll Do

- Own the edit from raw footage to final delivery, shaping narrative structure, pacing, and emotional beats

- Edit short-form videos for TikTok, Reels, and other social platforms with a strong understanding of retention and flow

- Lead visual storytelling through motion graphics and animation, using effects intentionally to enhance the story

- Source and integrate b-roll or stock footage that meaningfully supports the narrative

- Collaborate closely with a Creative Strategist, contributing creative judgment and refining concepts through iteration

- Design and maintain motion assets such as lower thirds and animated information graphics

- Handle color correction and audio polishing to ensure a clean, consistent final product

- Manage files, versions, and deadlines independently in an async workflow



What We’re Looking For

- A portfolio that demonstrates strong storytelling, pacing, and motion design - not just technical edits

- Advanced proficiency in Adobe Premiere Pro and After Effects

- Deep understanding of narrative structure

- Strong motion design fundamentals (timing, easing, visual hierarchy)

- Confident audio storytelling skills (music selection, sound design, clean dialogue)

- Ability to make creative decisions independently and explain your reasoning

- Experience working from creative briefs and collaborating asynchronously (Slack, 
)

- Highly organized, reliable, and comfortable managing multiple versions and feedback cycles

- Familiarity with short-form platforms and social-first editing conventions

- Bonus: Photoshop or basic design experience



Salary: $1,500.00 - $2,000.00 per month based on experience

title: Video Editor / Content Creator (Short-Form + Long-Form)
description:
What You’ll Do

1) Edit Short-Form Content (Primary)

* Edit Reels/TikToks/Shorts from raw footage into tight, high-retention videos.

* Create strong hooks, pacing, captions, and pattern interrupts that feel current—not templated.

* Deliver multiple variations when needed (different hooks, text, CTA, length).

2) Edit Long-Form YouTube Content

* Assemble long-form videos with clean storytelling: structure, pacing, b-roll, audio, and color.

* Build compelling intros (no slow ramps), clear chapters, and satisfying endings.

* Produce cutdowns from long-form into short-form content packages.

3) Be Trend-Aware (Creator Brain)

* Track weekly trends: audio, formats, editing styles, 
s, captions, transitions.

* Recommend trend applications that fit each brand (especially medical/aesthetic brands where compliance and tone matter).

* Pitch “content angles” from raw footage (what will work + why).

4) Post-Production Polish

* Captions (burned-in + native), motion graphics, light sound design, subtle VFX when relevant.

* Clean audio (dialogue clarity, leveling), color correction, and consistent brand look.

* Organize assets, project files, and exports in our Drive/frame workflow.

5) Collaborate Like a Pro

* Work closely with our creative lead and account team to hit deadlines and maintain quality.

* Take feedback quickly, do clean revisions, and communicate clearly.

title: Part-Time Marketing Lead (HubSpot, Content, CRM) — Long-Term Role
description:
About the Role

We are a boutique U.S. law firm seeking a part-time Marketing Lead to manage and execute our marketing systems.

This is a long-term opportunity for someone who wants a stable working relationship and consistent hours.

You will work directly with the business owner (attorney) and will have ownership over marketing execution, content, and HubSpot management.

This is not a virtual assistant role.

We are looking for someone who understands marketing systems and can think independently.



About the Firm

Our firm focuses on:

• Business Law

• Equine / Equestrian Law (horse industry)

We have been operating for nearly 20 years and are now entering a growth phase, especially in our business law practice.

Our goal is to build consistent lead generation and strong marketing systems over the next 12–24 months.

We are looking for someone who wants to grow with us long-term.



Responsibilities



HubSpot Management (Important)

•
 campaigns and newsletters

• Contact segmentation and lists

• Workflow automation

• Lead tracking and lifecycle stages

• Data cleanup and organization

• Reporting and dashboards



Content & Social Media

• Plan and create content for LinkedIn, Instagram,
, and YouTube

• Repurpose videos into short-form content

• Schedule posts and monitor engagement

• Maintain professional brand tone



Marketing Execution

• Translate business goals into marketing tasks

• Assist with campaign planning and execution

• Identify opportunities to improve marketing performance



Lead Tracking & Reporting

• Update marketing tracking spreadsheet

• Track lead sources and performance

• Provide weekly summary reports

• Monitor results and suggest improvements



Video & Content Support

• Edit recorded videos into reels and short clips

• Assist with scripting and content planning



What We Are Looking For

Required:

• Hands-on HubSpot experience

• Experience managing marketing campaigns

• Strong written English

• Ability to work independently

• Organized and detail-oriented

• Comfortable learning about legal services

• Reliable internet and computer

• Available 25–30 hours per week



Preferred:

• Marketing automation experience

• CRM experience

• Professional services or consulting marketing

• Video editing skills

• Experience working with U.S. clients



Work Hours

• Part-time: 25–30 hours per week

• Must have some daily overlap with U.S. Pacific Time

Schedule can be flexible as long as work is completed reliably.



Compensation

$1,500 – $2,200 per month, depending on experience and skill level

(Part-time equivalent of approximately $18–$25/hour)



Higher compensation may be considered for strong HubSpot experience.



We pay consistently and on time.



Long-Term Opportunity

We are looking for someone to work with for years, not months.

If you are dependable and perform well, this role can grow over time.



How to Apply (Important)

To apply, please include:

1. Your experience with HubSpot (specific tasks you performed)

2. Marketing platforms you have personally managed

3. Your weekly availability

4. Your internet speed

5. A short paragraph describing your marketing experience

6. The word HubSpot in the first sentence of your application

Applications without the word HubSpot will not be considered.



Why You Might Enjoy This Role

• Stable long-term client

• Professional work environment

• Clear expectations

• Opportunity to grow skills

• Consistent hours

• Direct communication with business owner



Please answer the following questions:

• Describe a HubSpot workflow you created.

• How do you track marketing performance?

• How many clients do you currently work with?
